_source.complaint_what_happened: I am currently looking to discontinue my payment arrangements with Pro Collect Debt agency regarding my outstanding balance with XXXX Prior to today I did not have any previous issues but this is cause for concern since I do not want any further inconveniences with my credit. I made payment arrangements of {$100.00} due on the XXXX of each month and was contacted today at XXXX am stating my payment was declined due to insufficient funds. I find this concerning because XXXX I work for my financial institution and can verify if a payment was declined for this reason, and I would have also seen a charge of {$29.00} hit my account. My account had sufficient funds to not only cover the amount but also the fee of {$7.00}. After speaking with XXXX or XXXX a payment of {$100.00} was successfully processed. I do not wish to receive further calls stating my payment was declined due to Insufficient funds and was able to speak with the apartment manager XXXX or XXXX regarding the issue of the phone call and my concern for my future payments. She did offer assistance in processing future payments via a Money Order and honoring the current balance of {$790.00}. I find not only a concern that the assigned Account XXXX sped through the last phone call I had with her, but also a concern that when attempting to resolve this matter with a Supervisor, I was transferred multiple times only to receive a busy signal. I also find it discomforting that during a LiveChat session with XXXX XXXX required my full Social Security Number to simply tell me that they can not send me any proof until I have paid the account in full. It is disturbing the lack of customer service debt collectors have. I speak from personal experience in assisting my place of employment as well.
_source.issue: Communication tactics

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XXXX I pulled my three bureau credit report using a credit monitoring service and I discovered an account being collected by ProCollect, Inc., a debt collector located in XXXX, TX. They were collecting on behalf of an apartment complex. They showed I had a balance of {$3400.00}. ( SEE PAGE 19 OF ITEM # 1 ) On XXXX I sent ProCollect a standard dispute letter and asked them to provide evidence of the debt 's validity. I later received a statement dated XXXX that showed a balance of {$1900.00} and included an incomplete breakdown of some accounting that indicated a balance of {$2200.00}. The {$2200.00} included a final line item charge of {$1900.00} with no clear information about what the {$1900.00} charge was for. There was also included a partial lease agreement that was missing sections or pages. ( SEE ITEM # 2 IS EVERYTHING THEY SENT ) On XXXX I mailed them a second dispute letter outlining all the issues I found with their attempted validation. ( SEE ITEM # 3 ATTACHED ) Also, on XXXX I pulled the reports again and saw all of the balances were still reporting {$3400.00} and ProCollect had not marked the item as disputed with any of the bureaus even though they had completed their investigation and sent me their validation documents. ( SEE ITEM # 4 SEE PAGE 14 )  Them not reporting after completing their investigation to update the account is a violation of the FCRA. Finally, as of this week, the account is still reporting with multiple discrepancies with amounts, dates, etc. ( SEE ITEM # 5 PAGE 18 ) In summary, my arguments are they knowingly reported a balance due that was nearly double the amount they had showing in their system. I feel this was a deliberate attempt to extort extra money from me. When asked to validate the debt they could only produce documentation for about {$1900.00} on one item and about {$2200.00} on another obviously far less than they were demanding. Secondly, they completed their investigation in approximately 2 weeks and mailed me documentation confirming it, but they did not report to the bureaus to update the account after their investigation was completed. That is two clear violations of the FCRA and FDCPA.
_source.issue: False statements or representation

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Under the FDCPA, you have the right to debt validation. This means a consumer can demand that a creditor reporting information to the credit bureaus prove the account is really your responsibility and that the balances are accurate. I have tried several times contacting the collection agency showing on my credit report " Pro Collect & XXXX XXXX XXXX '' for debt validation. I have also contacting the credit bureaus several times for debt validation. Neither has shown proof of debt validation. 

According to FDCPA the law states : " If the collection agency failed to validate the debt and has sent a notice of the debt to a consumer reporting agency, the notice of the debt must be removed. If not, send a notice of the failure of the validation to each consumer reporting agency that lists the debt. Unless the credit reporting agency can validate the debt, it should be removed from your credit report. If the collection agency sends you proof they have the right to collect the debt, the debt is yours, and the amount is accurate, then the debt is validated. '' It has been well over 30 days for the collection agencies and the credit bureaus for showing proof of debt validation. Therefore I am asking that Pro Collect Inc & XXXX XXXX XXXX to be removed from my credit report immediately.
_source.issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I used to live in Campus Habitat Apartments for 3 years from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. The place was filthy disgusting and consistently was being bought out by a new management company every few months. They also had buildings with condemned apartments in them and almost were shut down due to how disgusting they are. 

A few months before our lease ended, our kitchen started to leak water from somewhere. We did n't know if it was dishwasher, sink what it was but it got to the point that we had about XXXX-XXXX inches of standing water in our kitchen. We made numerous phone calls to the office asking for someone to come take care of it and they refused. We let them know that if they did not take care of it we would not pay rent until they did. So we lived there for 2 months without paying rent and the problem never being fixed. Our apartment continuing to leak water all over the kitchen every time we cleaned it up again. When we moved out, we went to the office to hand in our keys and let them know that we did not clean up all the towels and stuff we had on the floor due to the water damage because it was not our fault and we were disgusted. We also let them know that the rent would not be paid for that because part of our lease states they were to respond to maintenance requests and they never did so since they did n't hold up their end of the lease agreement, we would not pay. We lived with a flooded kitchen and disgusting smell of molded wet towels barely even able to cook or pack up in our kitchen. I gave them the address to our new apartment for my security deposit and such and left. 

1 year later I go to apply to a new complex with my boyfriend and I find that I am declined. When I ask why they state it was because I owe money to XXXX XXXX and that it 's on my credit report. This comes as a shock to me as I had moved out of that apartment over a year ago and have never received a phone call, letter, invoice nothing stating that I owed any money to them. I knew that I had refused to pay rent for 2 months but since they never sent anything to me asking for payment nor contacted me about it on the phone, I assumed they let it go as they were wrong by not making my apartment XXXX livable and I could take them to court over it. So I contacted them after looking at my credit report and seeing that on XX/XX/XXXX they placed me with a collections agency regarding my past due money. When I contacted them I asked what besides my rent they were trying to claim I owed them, as my rent was not enough to equate to {$1100.00} at all. They claimed I owed for some damages, repainting and re-carpeting and such as well because they had no record of anyone 's move in sheets that were filled out 3 years prior since they company had been bought out by so many different new management companies during that time. They also could not provide me with a written statement or invoice for a breakdown of the charges they told me just to come in and write a check. At this point it was also yet another company that owned them than what it was when I moved out. I expressed that I wanted a manager to call me back immediately to dispute this because it was absolutely obscene and I never received a phone call. To this day, I still have not received a phone call, written notice or invoice. Somehow they also could not explain why I never received a security deposit back or why that did not pay towards the balance. And I also now see that the complex themselves not only has YET ANOTHER new management company but they have an entirely new name for the apartments. I do not know who to contact to get this account off my credit report as a negative mark. I do n't know if I have to take them to small claims to dispute it and show them pictures of the disgusting hallways and apartments and condemned buildings with broken locks and all this information.
_source.issue: Disclosure verification of debt

_source.complaint_what_happened:
We moved out of our apartment in XXXX. We left the apartment immaculate, even cleaning behind the oven and vacuuming our way out of the apartment. 

Several weeks later the apartment management presented us with a bill for "repairs" that was full of mistakes and most of the items included were false and/or in violation of the Texas Property Code. In other words, almost all the charges were for things we either didn't owe or were for things that they could not charge for by law.

We attempted to resolve with the apartment management, but they refused to remove the wrong / illegal items. Instead they sent it to collections.

This is causing us serious financial and emotional distress. We are in the process of closing on a house and the closing is held up because of the disputed collection on our credit report. Additionally, this is causing us to incur higher interest rates and fees and will cost us thousands of dollars.

The collections agency filed a collection on our credit reports. We have attempted to resolve via the proper channels:

XX/XX/XXXX: we sent letters to the XXXX credit bureaus per the FCRA to dispute the information and request them to validate the data. All XXXX responded that they investigated and that the creditor says it was valid. When called to discuss, the credit bureaus said "you need to have the collection agency remove. We just ask them if it is valid."

XX/XX/XXXX: we sent a letter to the collection agency per the FCRA and FDCPA asking them to validate the data. They replied that the creditor said it was valid and sent us copies of the lease and the form showing the illegal/wrong charges. They provided no proof.

XX/XX/XXXX: we sent a letter to the collection agency per the FCRA and FDCPA stating that what they provided was not proof. It also clearly stated what was incorrect or illegally reported, and requested they remove the improper charges and remove the collection from my credit reports. They replied on XX/XX/XXXX that the creditor contends the charges were valid and resent the same information from their previous letter. No proof was supplied.

XX/XX/XXXX: we sent a letter to the XXXX credit bureaus per the FCRA to inform them that we asked the collection agency to validate the debt and remove if incorrect, and that the collection agency could not do this. We requested they remove the collection or we would file a complaint with the FTC and/or pursue legal action.
_source.issue: Disclosure verification of debt

A Few years ago XXXX was informed informed that XXXX XXXX and I were no longer together and that the debt my solo debt. The Original Lease was a prorated rent and the Apartment complex charged late fees even after the Manager agreed that final bill I received was the final bill.. there has been added 650 $ additional.

They contacted XXXX XXXX today ... His voice mail is clear that it was NOT my voicemail and the number was some how reentered into their system. And they told XXXX they were collect debt of mine. Which is a pure violation of personal information violation. The voice mail is saved!

They also keep saying I am refusing to pay the debt even though multiple attempts have been made to get the bill corrected and they refuse to follow the no collections of additional Fees.

As far as the rudeness they are constantly talking over me, refuse to let me complete my statements, constantly hang up on, and even put someone on hold for extended lengths. _source.complaint_what_happened: O n  XX/XX/XXXX , I  sent a certified written dispute to  Procollect disputing the debt they claimed I owed ( see attached ). I also requested documentation that proves that I owe Procollect as well as a breakdown  of fees for such de bt. Procollect DID NOT provide me with proper documentation. O n   XX/XX/XXXX , they  sent me a standard dunning lette r (  see attached ) with a printout of some information on a piece of paper with a name on it that is similar to mine that supposedly shows  XXXX  transactions made back in   XX/XX/XXXX   ( see attached ). First and foremost, my name is  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX , my father, my  XXXX  cousins, and both of my sons all bear the same name, as well as countless others in the state of Louisiana. So whose debt is this? I will say again, I am unaware of such debt. Secondly, this printout was NOT a billing statement from the creditor that shows a detailed breakdown of the services rendered nor did it show a breakdown of fees or how they came to the amount they say I owe. This also was n't a contractual agreement bearing my signature. Procollect is playing games and trying to get me to pay an unverified debt they have no proof that it is mine.     Under the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I have the right to request validation of the debt they say I owe. So, I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party they are asking to pay this debt, the date of the alleged medical service, and proof that there is some contractual obligation which is binding on me to pay this debt. Since I could n't get the proper documentation from Procollect via certified mail and they have violated the FDCPA by reporting a unvalidated debt to the credit reporting agencies, I am requesting again that this account is deleted from my credit reports or please provide me with the proper documentation, so this debt can be resolved.     Please attach copies of : Any agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt, or proof of acquisition of purchase or assignment, and authorization under subtitle D of the  ARRA, SEC. 13401 . Also, provide copies of any agreement that bears my sig nature wherein I have agreed to pay the creditor and as this is a medical account a copy of any HIP AA authorization.     In the event of noncompliance, I reserve the right to file charges in a small claims action against your  company, seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. ) Defamation 2. ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. ) Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act & FDCPA.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened: I disputed XXXX ProCollect accounts in my credit file with the CRA. Procollect inturn sent was they considered " validation of the debt '' to me via mail. First, I never received anything regarding this debt before discovering it in my credit report in XXXX 2015. Secondly, when I attempted contact the original creditor, I find that they are no longer in business. So, when I received the " validation '' from Procollect, it showed me nothing! I have attached scanned copies of the attachment that procollect sent me as validation of the debts appearing in my credit file for {$600.00}, {$620.00} and {$620.00}. This does not constitute sufficient validation of the debt. This is something that I could have typed up myself. Surely this is not what they send others who are requesting debt validation. And sadly, this was what the CRA used to place this debt in my credit file. I emailed procollect informing them that this was not sufficient and they would have to supply the proper validation according to the laws in the state of Texas and I expected these accounts to be removed from my account. The 30 day period has expired.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I sent a certified letter to ProCollect regarding a collections account they placed on my credit report asking them to validate the debt. In response I received a detailed bill and a " copy '' of a lease that was allegedly signed by me. The information they sent me did not include a copy of my ID or drivers license and the signature is not mines however this company continues to report tradeline to the 3 major credit bureaus. This is creating major issues for me such as job declines, higher interest rates, lower credit scores, and application rejects for balances owed. I believe this account DOES NOT belong to me, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act all unverified accounts must be deleted. I contacted the apartment complex XXXX XXXX XXXX directly which they advised they don't have any information pertaining to previous residents. That also stated that XXXX was a previous apt management company that managed billing and is no longer in business. I contacted the corporate office which stated they have no information due to XXXX managing in the past and they are no longer in business. They stated they are under new management and unable to assist me, so HOW DID PROCOLLECT PROPERLY VALDATE THIS DEBT? The only information I received from ProCollect was a copy of a application, detailed bill, and a copy of a lease that I allegedly signed which I DID NOT. These items do not qualify as full verification per FCRA. This company is in violation for continuing to verify the accounts with the credit bureaus without providing the proper evidence as requested. A fraud alert has been on my credit report due to my identity being stolen, so a copy of my ID or Drivers license should be on file for verification purposes, and none was sent with the information Procollect sent me. The information on the application DOES NOT belong to me, THE SIGNATURE is NOT MINES. I never lived on XXXX XXXX which is listed on the apartment application, anyone can have my employment information. They are major discrepancies which this company is intentionally ignoring and the law is clear as to civil liability and remedies available to me ( section 616 & 617 ) if you fail to comply with Federal law. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursing litigation in the matter to enforce my rights under FCRA.
_source.issue: Incorrect information on your report

_source.complaint_what_happened: I have filed disputes against a debt on my XXXX credit report. I have spoken to the original creditor, and I have spoken to the debt collector. Both have stated that they do not have me in their records. Both have verified that my name and social does not match, and that it is a mistake. Neither are willing to provide a letter reflecting that. Both assure me that filing a dispute with XXXX would fix the problem, but I have done this twice and no deletion. XXXX has told me that upon investigation, The collections agancy, has replied that the debt is indeed mine. I have never lived in that apartment complex. The collections agency, Procollect, has given me the run around completely. They give me extension numbers, and email addresses that dont exist. They asked me to call them back with proof that they were reporting onto my XXXX account. I hung up the phone logged into XXXX, and called them back. They stated that no one by the name I was given works at that office. It literally took less that 10 minutes. Other times I have called and they connot fine the file in question. My bank has a debt resolution company that was assigned to my case. Except Procollect doesnt accept calls from 3rd parties. In dealing with Procollect, I have been yelled at, called a liar, and hung up on. I would hate to see how people who actually have a debt are treated.

A collection agency, Pro Collect, is trying to collect a debt that should not exist. 

In XXXX of 2012, I discontinued payment on a storage unit due to financial difficulties. Within a couple of weeks of non-payment, I received a notice from the storage facility that the locks would be cut and my items would be sold at auction. I received a prelien notice on XXXX, a lock cut notice on XXXX and a notice that my items were to be sold at auction on XXXX/XXXX/2012. With rent at the storage costing $ XXXX/mo, the items sold at auction should have well covered the month of rent that was due. 

It has been 3 years since I have heard anything about the storage unit. Now, 3 years later, Pro Collect, a collection agency, is trying to collect {$6800.00} in back rent on the storage unit. This is outrageous and a complete scam!

_source.complaint_what_happened:
TO : XXXX XXXX & CEO/President XXXX XXXX Pro Collect/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Cc : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, New York XXXX Cc : N.A.A.C.P. 
National Chapter XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX MD XXXX FROM : XXXX XXXX EMAIL : XXXXXXXXXXXX REF : Frivolous and Criminal Lawsuit DATE : XX/XX/XXXX Sir/Madam As a child of XXXX, as a young Veteran, as a Gold Star Family Member, I must tell you your company received the wrong complaint. This is the complaint you all should have received. My uncle assisted me in this illegitimate, and unlawful collection predicament. He sent the complaint to the wrong company when it justly belongs to your unprofessional company. 
My uncle got involved when he found out XXXX XXXX XXXX employee made an ethnically prejudiced assertion to me when I called your business. Just like you are sending me paperwork vis -- vis my lease. I am sending you a copy of my lease I signed with another apartment complex when I left XXXX. 
These two leases crossed each other after I gave XXXX my thirty days notice on the XX/XX/XXXX I moved out two-week early. I even gave XXXX a copy of my new lease where I presently reside. Before you make shiftless extortions about a situation you scarcely know about, I can only educate you to be cautious. You agreed with XXXX on a lie without examining the facts maam, knowing those past employees are long gone. 
It seems to me, Pro Collect Inc. and XXXX need a human behavior course, and some racially sensitive training to comprehend mere mortals intelligently, and temperament. Since you do not have evidence to support your falsehood. I will help you out. First, my work schedule would not permit me to move during business hours. I asked XXXX XXXX XXXX what should I do with the keys after hours. She instructed me where to put them, and I put them exactly where I was told. 
I left a message that night on the voicemail letting her know I did exactly what she instructed me to do. She never returned my call. I thought everything was fine. When I finally heard something about this incidence, I got a letter from Municipal Court that was forwarded to my new address. By that time, the court date, and the appeal process had passed. 
This begs more questions than answers. I called XXXX again to let her know that I have been gone from there for a while. She stated, they couldnt locate the key. I refreshed her memory regarding our conversation. She told me to hold on. When she came back to the phone after ten minutes or so, she said she found the keys and apologized. I asked her about the court situation. 
She told me not to worry and she would take care of it. I should have worried after looking back in regretful reflection. I got sued for {$2000.00} in court for KEYS I returned. I dont owe any money to XXXX. Why would I stay there when I had moved into another apartment complex? The chutzpah of you maam to labor me as such, and corrupted my credit file where I can not get my V.A. loan. 
Evidently, this is an illegal sham with malicious forethought, or XXXX has some very bad bookkeeping problems. Either one leads me to believe that your collection company and XXXX are practicing a sense of criminality mixed with malevolent and foul intentions. However, these are the trickery and the foolery a leasing office plays with tenants. 
Especially, when they have the backing of a ruthless collection company that has frightening intentions to degrade and besmirched an innocent Veteran/Gold Star Family Member under the faade of fair collection practices. 
Maam, you are more than uninformed, you are twisting the law as it stands. This makes you extremely dangerous! The federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) governs the behavior of debt collectors and debt collection agencies. It places limits on what you can do, or can not do in collecting a no owe debt from me. Unfortunately, despite the law, Pro Collect Inc. are still engrossed in these illegal collection tactics. 
I called your business, I carefully explained the whole situation to your employee, and she said, you people never do right. You people? This phrase has long been used as an interpersonal generalization toward one culture. It has become known as a XXXX sobriquet that targeted African-Americans only. 
This XXXX has manifested itself in terms of individual behavior at Pro Collect Inc., and XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX through hate with institutional behavior. This racism is propagated and publicized under the expert tutelage of XXXX XXXX & CEO XXXX XXXX, the overseers at Pro Collect Inc. This is a classic move of evil. However, one characteristic of evil, it contains a seed of its own destruction. 
I decided to bring this tragedy of injustice up this week for a reason. This week we are celebrating XXXX XXXX XXXX birthday, and this is coinciding with the boycott my uncle is planning against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Georgia. Furthermore, injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere. 
I thank XXXX and give Him the praises by allowing my uncle to be a lifelong member, and a vice-president of the N.A.C.C.P. I am letting you know XXXX XXXX & CEO XXXX XXXX. We have reached out to XXXX XXXX with XXXX, Petition Online, XXXX. We will live stream the boycott through XXXX, and XXXX. I will let the world know Pro Collect Inc. had two years to right this wrong, or square this circle, and you stubbornly didnt, and you stubbornly wont. 
I will leave you with a quote from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity ( XXXX, XXXX ). It is XXXX and the ghost of XXXX XXXX is alive and well.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
In XXXX 2015 we left our apartment in XXXX as our lease has ended. Before our last day the property management requested for a new mailing address in case they needed to contact us so I provided our new home/mailing address in XXXX, MD. Months have passed and I received a refund check from the apartment amounting to {$20.00}. In XXXX 2015, my nephew, who was also on the lease, found out that there was a derogatory report from XXXX XXXX amounting to over {$500.00}, I checked my credit report and I had it too, my friend, who was on the lease, had it too. We found out that it was from XXXX XXXX Apartment. I immediately contacted the apartment to inquire about this debt and asked them why would I receive a refund if we owe money to them. They could n't give me a clear answer and i was told that they would just notify us after they found out what was going on. We waited for 2 weeks and we didnt hear from them. On XXXX XXXX i contacted them again to follow up. They told me that we owe money for cleaning fee, unpaid untility bills etc. But i asked them why they never informed us regarding this debt, their answer was they sent the statement in XXXX but never heard from us. I told them that I never received anything and I wanted to see their mailing receipt but according to them they sent it via regular USPS mail so there was no receipt. I asked them again why they did n't try to contact me via email or phone before sending it to collection but they didnt say anything. It looks like they didnt exert effort to reach any of us before deciding to turn the debt over to the collection ruining our credit. 
We never received any letter from the collection company too! The property manager sent me an email telling me that they will contact the collection to hold the debt and remove it from our credit for 30 days and we have to pay the debt within that period of time or the adverse report will be back on our credit. We are not running away from the unpaid bills ( if any ), our main concern is the derogatory report that they made and prevented us from making loans, apply for credit cards, etc. for 5 months without our knowledge. We believe that this is not a fair practice of credit reporting and we strongly believe that the people who mismanaged this issue deserve disciplinary action.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I recently reviewed my credit report for inaccuracies and I noticed a company called " Pro Collect '' reporting a debt to XXXX, XXXX XXXXnd XXXX on my credit report for {$760.00} on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. I did research on the company to make sure it was a legal company and they were legally able to collect debt. I searched the State of Texas XXXX website and their is no record of this company in their database to collect debt. I am not sure if this company is running a scam. According to the State of Texas this company is in violation and I would like for them to be removed from my credit report. 

FINANCE CODE TITLE 5. PROTECTION OF CONSUMERS OF FINANCIAL SERVICES CHAPTER 392. DEBT COLLECTION SUBCHAPTER B. SURETY BOND Sec. 392.101. BOND REQUIREMENT. ( a ) A third-party debt collector or credit bureau may not engage in debt collection unless the third-party debt collector or credit bureau has obtained a surety bond issued by a surety company authorized to do business in this state as prescribed by this section. A copy of the bond must be filed with the secretary of state.
( b ) The bond must be in favor of : ( 1 ) any person who is damaged by a violation of this chapter ; and ( 2 ) this state for the benefit of any person who is damaged by a violation of this chapter.
( c ) The bond must be in the amount of {$10000.00}.
Acts 1997, 75th Leg., ch. 1008, Sec. 1, eff. Sept. 1, 1997.
Sec. 392.102. CLAIM AGAINST BOND. A person who claims against a bond for a violation of this chapter may maintain an action against the third-party debt collector or credit bureau and against the surety. The aggregate liability of the surety to all persons damaged by a violation of this chapter may not exceed the amount of the bond.
Acts 1997, 75th Leg., ch. 1008, Sec. 1, eff. Sept. 1, 1997.

The manager at that time told me that I was fine. I do not have any other documents from them telling me that I owe money. 

So I do not recognize this debt, since the manager canceled it.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I was a resident of XXXX Apartments from XX/XX/XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX. Once I moved out the apartment complex charged me XXXX for repairs they said they had to make, which was untrue. This debt has been forwarded to the collection agency Pro collect. I spoke with them about this debt and explained that I did n't owe this amount because I left the apartment clean. They were not interested they said I owed the amount. I then filed a complaint with the XXXX apartment association and they investigated the matter. They found that I did not owe this amount and the apartment complex did n't have any pictures or proof of said damages. They found that I only owed XXXX dollars and some change for normal wear and tear. The property management company XXXX also received a copy of the findings. However they refused to accept a payment from me and the collection agency is reporting this on my credit every 90 days or so. The last reporting was XX/XX/XXXX. I have sent them Pro Collect collection agency a copy of the email I received from the XXXX apartment association including the correct amount owed. They have chosen to ignore it. As a matter of fact XXXX XXXX the collection agent in charge of my account hung up in my face and refused to take my calls. They know they are reporting a lie I have sent them the evidence. I have also filed disputes with XXXX and XXXX  regarding this matter.
_source.issue: False statements or representation

_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.complaint_what_happened: In XX/XX/XXXX I signed a six month agreement with XXXX. I signed the lease over from another person. The apartment complex agreed that I would live in the property from XXXX XXXX until XXXX XXXX. In XX/XX/XXXX when I went to turn in my keys management told me that I owed rent up until XXXX XXXX. They said that they would not try to find anyone else. Even if I found someone else they wanted me to still pay the next six months, which is illegal. They told me that If I did n't pay the next six months rent right then, they would turn it over to collections. I set up a meeting with management to try and discuss some alternatives. They kept giving me the run around and ignoring my calls and emails. A few weeks later I received a collection notice from Pro Collect for over {$3000.00} dollars which included huge fees for cleaning a tub and lost keys ( which I turned in ) and unpaid rent. I was only obligated to stay in the property for six months, and regardless it 's illegal for a landlord to not mitigate their damages. They sent my account over to collections for six months accelerated rent three weeks after I moved out of the property. This is illegal! They ignored all my calls and attempts to work something out, they told me to pay up the next six months rent or they would send it to collections right away. They intentionally ruined my credit without making any attempts to mitigate their damages which the law requires. When I contacted Pro Collect through a written letter, and called showing evidence of this unfair charge they told me to sue XXXX. They admitted that I was right about the landlord 's duty to mitigate their damages, however if I wanted this off my credit I would have to sue the apartment complex, and that would cost me more than paying the {$3000.00} that they were attempting to collect. They also advised me that disputing this charge would hurt my credit. I later called back to try and get more explanation on how it was legally to try and collect when they broke the law, the lady said she was n't there to argue with me and proceeded to end the phone call. They refuse to remove this from my credit, even though legally the apartment complex broke the law.
_source.issue: Cont'd attempts collect debt not owed

I am getting the law directly from your policy FCRA 609. If original debt can not be verified it has to be removed.. This law requires every company that reports credit events -- not just the original creditor companies -- to be able to produce verifiable proof of the negative event. It holds the credit reporting agencies accountable for the negative information they pass on. This is obviously related to the right of debtors to challenge the accuracy of negative events reported on them. The intent of the government was to protect debtors from having inaccurate information used against them .... _source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I was granted permission per XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for a termination of my lease based of security and hazardous living conditions. Procollect Inc. has received this account to collect upon and they will not use the information I have provided to verify this account is inaccurate. I have contacted Procollect Inc. on numerous occasions and have received the worst customer service I have ever received from any collection agency. There are a number of reasons I would like this account to be fully investigated based off dates, emails, police reports and evidence provided. 
1. Procollect Inc. has failed to provide an explanation for the reason of the additional month of rent and fees. 
2. Procollect Inc. has provided three different explanation of the current charges and I have not received any validation or verification letter. I have been requesting this information since XX/XX/XXXX. I have only received offers to pay 50 %. 
3. Procollect Inc. will not accept evidence I have presented as they have verified that the evidence I have provided is accurate and correct. I was told that contacting the original creditor would not make any difference but they would investigate and have found this to be true. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I was granted permission per XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX for a termination of my lease based of security and hazardous living conditions. I was at an age I was not familiar with receiving a XXXX balanced lease ( as Procollect has requested ) to ensure this would have happened. However, I was granted permission to remove myself from their property due to first a sewer issue that caused XXXX to flood all pipe lines and the floor of the apartment. I begged to leave the permission from the time I moved in because all the issues that were occurring. After the last incident ( police report included ) upon moving in I was told that this complex had a camera system and ensured the safety of their residence, however, this was untrue and someone damaged my vehicle in front of a camera in use sign. The safety and security of their residence was being falsely advertised and I was only a college student that didnt expect to move into such a horrible place. The police and Health department was involved and on XX/XX/XXXX I was granted permission to leave and a report was filed on the damages of my car. I never knew that this account was sent to collections and this has been affecting me build my credit because this is inaccurate. 
Procollect Inc. has stated that I am being charged XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX which is for an additional month of rent and some key change fees but I had to submit the keys by XX/XX/XXXX and why charge for a key change if the keys were submitted. Once keys are submitted no fees should be added. The rent was {$550.00} a month and I am being charged {$640.00} as this does not make any since. 
I have spoken with XXXX, XXXX and a XXXX XXXX in regards to this account at Procollect I have provided all evidence and the evidence provided has not been accepted. I was told that I refused payment, I had 3 days until payment, didnt care about my safety or security in regards to this matter, my evidence was not enough and they wouldnt take any evidence that I had although verified by the original account owner and last but not least that they have provided different stories based on the evidence that I present and i do not believe this is fair. 
Although Procollect Inc and I have had some issues in the past with resolving this debt, and I was treated horribly, this debt is inaccurate and I would like to come to a conclusion based of facts, dates and proof. I have never had a lease contract with Procollect but XXXX XXXX terminated my lease indicating I have a {$0.00} balance.

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XXXXXX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX file a judgment against me at the XXXX XXXX XXXX. The court date was scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX. I went to court and a judgment was established. I was ordered to pay XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I went to the apartment complex formerly known as XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX is now under new management and is called The XXXX XXXX. Not being aware of how to resolve and settle the debt, I went to the XXXX Municipal Court Clerk. I was advised the payment will have to be submitted to the original debtor before the judgment could be considered satisfied. I went to The XXXX XXXX ( formerly known as XXXX XXXX ) on XX/XX/XXXX. I tried to pay with a check so I could have a record. However, the representative stated they would only accept cash. I went to the bank to withdraw the funds ( {$760.00} ). The funds were then taken to The XXXX XXXX office. The representative printed out a judgment satisfied form and stated I would have to take the receipt back to the XXXX Municipal Court. A year later ( XX/XX/XXXX ),  ProCollect Inc was still reporting a balance the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). I contacted ProCollect Inc by phone on XX/XX/XXXX. The ProCollect representative stated I would have to email the receipt to them. I emailed the receipt to XXXX. I called back to make sure the information was received. The representative stated the receipt was received. However, the receipt must state the account balance is {$0.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX, I went back to The XXXX XXXX ( formerly known as XXXX XXXX ) to get another receipt stating the balance is {$0.00} and the judgment was satisfied. I submitted both receipts ( via email ) to XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I called ProCollect back to ensure they received both receipts. However, I was unable to speak with a representative. A week later, I received a letter in the mail stating the balance is {$670.00} and collection attempts will be made. At this point, I am frustrated with ProCollect Inc and start seeking paid debt information. I was informed I should file a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission.

I called 'Procollect rent collection agency ' at their phone number XXXX to settle an outstanding rental debt that I wasn't even aware of. I first spoke with a lady ( I didn't get her name ) who was very abusive and aggressive in her language. I gently asked her that I was willing to settle the debt with not the full amount ( {$1600.00} ) but with what I have - which was {$1100.00}. She berated me repeatedly and abused me for not accepting the offer that was made to me in 2015. I tried several times to explain to her the reasons for not being able to settle it, but she continued the aggressive berating. I asked her why she was mistreating me and was it due to the fact that I'm an XXXX and my name is XXXX and she said 'Have a nice day ' and hung up on me. 

I called back and asked to talk to a supervisor and they put me on hold for 10 minutes after which I hung up and called back. This time a lady named Ms. XXXX answered and asked me to hold and before I could reply, put me on hold once again for another 7 minutes after which I hung up. I called again and I asked the lady why they were putting me on indefinite hold and she put me through. I finally got through to XXXX XXXX and I explained to her the abuse I'd recieved earlier. She said that she trains all her employees not to be abusive which was not true at all. I asked her if she'd be able to offer me a settlement and she too rudely stated that she wouldn't and proceeded to read out the consequences. I asked her if my inability to pay would show on my credit report and Ms. XXXX STATED CLEARLY THAT THIS DEBT WOULD SHOW UP ON MY CREDIT REPORT. When I said that I'd checked all my credit reports ( XXXX, XXXX  & XXXX XXXX ) she reiterated that I was wrong that it indeed would show up on my credit report. I couldn't take anymore of her abuse and hung up. 

Ms. XXXX and her employees not only abused and berated me for not being able to pay, but she made a PATENTLY FALSE STATEMENT that my credit history would be negatively impacted by this particular rental debt.
_source.issue: Communication tactics

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/2018 a letter from XXXX XXXX which holds my Home Equity Line of Credit was sent to me saying that my funds were no longer available due to a report to the credit agency XXXX. I went to withdraw money for home improvements on XX/XX/XXXX, however I had not opened the letter from the bank at that time. I was denied access to my loan. I came home checked my credit report and there was a collection notice from Pro Collect Inc. of XXXX Texas in the amount of {$1000.00}. This amount is related to a judgement for a relative with the same last name and address as mine. Pro Collect has no documentation of any judgement against me because there isn't any. The amount matches the judgement amount for my relative. I called Pro Collect on XX/XX/18 and they refused to work with me. I have sent them a certified letter on XX/XX/18 telling them to remove this false report on my credit. I have also sent letters to all the credit reporting agencies on the same date. _source.complaint_what_happened: This complaint is against Procollect Incorporated collection agency. On XX/XX/XXXX I paid in full an account I had with them for the amount of {$1600.00}. When I called to pay my balance I was under the impression that it would be removed from my credit and it never was. It is affecting my credit score to this day because it keeps updating on my monthly credit report. I called Procollect on XX/XX/XXXX spoke to someone that told me it was not coming off of my credit report because I had disputed it with the credit bureaus. So I called the credit bureaus and asked them to remove the dispute so Procollect can update it and remove it from the credit report. They told me that the dispute had already dropped off because it had been over 30 days and there was no resolution. When I called Procollect back to inform them the dispute was removed I spoke to a different lady than the first time. She was being very rude as soon as she answered the phone she already knew my name. I told her I spoke to someone a week before and she said, " I know you already spoke someone about this on XX/XX/XXXX so what can we do for you now '' I asked her if they can update their records and remove this account from my credit report since the dispute was removed and she said that they don't delete accounts. So I told her the person I spoke to before told me it would be done and she just kept insisting that they don't do that and could give me no explanation of why the other lady said they would. When I tired to get their names they told me that information was irrelevant and then they hung up on me.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I had an account with XXXX XXXX. I switched to a much cheaper company in XX/XX/XXXX. I was set up on auto pay with a credit card and always paid my account on time every month. I paid a portion of my final bill while I waited to get my final bill to know what was owed. After a few weeks I went to the website and it showed a XXXX balance. I checked back a couple of times showing the same balance. When I called them I was told there was a XXXX balance so I didn't worry about it any more. Then a few months later I received a notice from a credit monitoring service that I had a collection account. I called XXXX again and they assured me I had a XXXX balance. I then was able to track down ProCollect who said I owed {$300.00}. I called them on XX/XX/XXXX, and they told me that if I paid it that day they would remove the collection from the credit bureau. I paid immediately. Not only did I pay it on XX/XX/XXXX, they didn't report it to XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX, almost 6 weeks later. My main complaint is I was told they would remove the collection from the credit reporting bureaus and they did not! They just reported it as paid. 

My credit history shows a perfect history of paying on times for years. XXXX told me and it was shown on my online account as paid so I could not make any kind of a payment. I never received any notification of a collection until I received a notice from my credit monitoring service. 

I paid ProCollect on the very first phone conversation and paid an amount that wasn't verified other than what they told me it was mostly because I thought it was close and they said they would remove the report from the credit bureaus. 

They should have to do what they say. They have a recording of our conversation.
_source.issue: Written notification about debt

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Under the FDCPA, you have the right to debt validation. This means a consumer can demand that a creditor reporting information to the credit bureaus prove the account is really your responsibility and that the balances are accurate. I have tried several times contacting the collection agency showing on my credit report " Pro Collect & XXXX XXXX XXXX '' for debt validation. I have also contacting the credit bureaus several times for debt validation. Neither has shown proof of debt validation. 

According to FDCPA the law states : " If the collection agency failed to validate the debt and has sent a notice of the debt to a consumer reporting agency, the notice of the debt must be removed. If not, send a notice of the failure of the validation to each consumer reporting agency that lists the debt. Unless the credit reporting agency can validate the debt, it should be removed from your credit report. If the collection agency sends you proof they have the right to collect the debt, the debt is yours, and the amount is accurate, then the debt is validated. '' It has been well over 30 days for the collection agencies and the credit bureaus for showing proof of debt validation. Therefore I am asking that Pro Collect Inc & XXXX XXXX XXXX to be removed from my credit report immediately.
_source.issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem

_source.complaint_what_happened: PROCOLLECT INC # XXXXhave a a unverified account from PROCOLLECT INC . I had previously disputed this account. I have never done business with PROCOLLECT INC. Pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) 15 U.S.C.1692g, I dispute the validity of the debt purport I owe. I request that PROCOLLECT INC Provide verification of the following : 1. ) The original Application or contract ; 2. ) Any and all statements allegedly related to this debt ; 3. ) Any and all signed receipts ; 4. ) Any and all canceled checks ; 5. ) Original date of default and collection activity begin 6. ). Whether you purchased the debt, and if so, the amount paid for the debt 7. ) The date ( s ) the debt allegedly accrued ; 8. ) An itemization of the costs, including an accounting, for any additional interest, charges, or other fees placed on this account. I want to request that PROCOLLECT INC Cease and Desist all further communications and collection actives and provide the verification of the purported debt. I need a physical copy for my records a contract, proof of claim, or any signed documentation for my review.

_source.complaint_what_happened: This is the most insensitive, aggressive, and rigid collections company I have ever dealt with. To start, I NEVER got any written notification of this debt. A lady called me in XX/XX/2018 while I was in XXXX - in the hospital - and I told her I could not deal with the collection at the moment due to being in XXXX but I would call back later that day or the following day to pay as I didn't have my wallet. She said that wasn't her concern, if I didn't settle the debt right that second she would report it to the credit agencies and note refusal to pay on my account. Her language was unacceptable during this call, she was loud, aggressive, threatening, and unwilling to work with me even as I said I would pay it within 24 hour period. I was in XXXX XXXX   and thankfully it stopped and I was discharged so I called back to arrange payment that following day. Again, she was beyond rude and I requested that it not be reported to the credit agencies since I was paying it as soon as it came to my attention, she agreed but it came up on my report a few weeks later. I have since disputed this several times with Procollect refusing to take down the report. When calling them, they refuse to allow you to speak to a supervisor and frequently hang up on you. They are always aggressive and yelling - absolutely no way to treat someone who is willing and trying to settle a debt. It is impossible to know who is really in charge but every single person is insensitive to my MEDICAL situation or the fact that they are on record stating it would not go to collections. They are threatening and dishonest and overall extremely rude to their customers. My account total was under {$350.00} and I shouldn't be treated this way for doing the right thing and paying off a debt that I wasn't made aware of until it was in the hands of these bullies.
_source.issue: Communication tactics

I am requesting that you allow me to validate the alleged debt. I am unaware of any outstanding medical bills that I possess, and I am seeking the name and hospital/medical provider to which I owe the debt and a detailed breakdown of the fees that I owe. 

Additionally, I am allowed under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ( HIPAA ) to protect my privacy and medical records from third parties. I did not give permission to any of my current or prior medical providers to release any of my medical information to a third party. I am aware that the HIPAA does allows the release of limited information about me but anything more is to only be revealed with the patient 's authorization. Therefore, my request is twofold -- validation of debt and HIPAA authorization. 

Please provide breakdown of fees including any collection costs and medical charges. 
Provide a copy of my signature with the provider of service to release my medical information to you. 
Cease any credit bureau reporting until the debt has been validated by me.
_source.issue: Cont'd attempts collect debt not owed

When I attempted to get information about the debt and what I was getting charged for, to sent me a " Make Ready Expenses '' report, with no receipts and no explanation. I was charged on their " Make Ready Expenses '' report for {$1400.00} for AC expenses over the period of almost a month. I was charged over {$1500.00} for landscaping cost, which was part of the dump pile they left when we first moved in ( it 's on Move In damage list report. 
All of these fees including the landscaping, and AC totaled {$5500.00}, with no explanation with most of these repairs being something we struggled with the whole time living there. 

They charged me many fees on trash and dump, which they allowed someone to come into OUR home while we were in the process of moving out and had stuff stolen, aquarium broken, and boxes that were gone through. 

Through out the time of living there, we had to deal with mice, them coming out constantly to fix the AC, as well as fighting XXXX when we first moved into the home. _source.complaint_what_happened:
While attempting to get approval for a loan to purchase a home, it was brought to my attention that there was a fraudulent collection on my credit report -- an apartment had been rented in my name in XXXX XXXX and reported to collections in XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$910.00}. On XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted XXXX via email, as well as, via phone call to begin the process of disputing the fraudulent collection claim. In addition, I reached out the apartment complex -- XXXX XXXX Apartments -- and expressed my concern regarding a fraudulent collection that had been reported in my name. The manager at the apartment complex invested the claim and told me that my name had not been reported by the apartment complex. On Monday, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I filed an Identity Theft Report with the Federal Trade Commission. 

On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I contacted XXXX to inquire about the status of my dispute. I was told that the dispute was still under investigation and that the reporting agency ( ProCollect ) maintained that I was the individual who had been reported by the apartment complex. I contacted ProCollect twice on XXXX XXXX and was told both times that my name and social were not in their database. The account number associated with the collection -- that was listed on my credit report -- -was in their database associated with someone else 's name and social security number. ProCollect vehemently denied reporting my name to XXXX because they had no record of me in their database. I contacted XXXX again on XXXX XXXX and shared this information with them. An XXXX supervisor insisted that ProCollect had denied the dispute on XXXX XXXX because they maintained that my name was associated with the account number. 

Neither agency is accepting responsibility for the fraudulent reporting of the collection on my credit report. I did not rent an apartment from XXXX XXXX in XXXX nor XXXX. If ProCollect has the account number that was reported listed for someone else, XXXX  shouldn't have placed the collection on my credit report. It is a fraudulent report and constitutes identity theft.
_source.issue: Incorrect information on your report

_source.company_public_response: Company believes the complaint is the result of a misunderstanding
_source.complaint_what_happened:
I mistakenly paid a {$68.00} invoice to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) instead of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) in XXXX XXXX. Despite the fact that the services were not provided by the XXXX XXXX, they negotiated the check anyway. 

In XXXX XXXX I received my first of many notices from the collection agent ProCo to which I explained the situation in writing. I heard nothing more until XXXX when I received another notice from ProCo. This time I contacted the XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX requesting that the Group simply transfer the {$68.00} to the Center. I was told that such a transfer was not possible, and so I suggested that the Group return the {$68.00} to me so I could then write a new check to the Center. Subsequent to my suggestion, the XXXX called me and said the transfer was possible and the issue was resolved, which I believed since I did not receive my {$68.00} from the XXXX. 

In XXXX XXXX I was contacted again by ProCo and then today, I received a notice from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. I 've responded to both. However, it seems to me that the XXXX is the company at fault here because 1 ) they accepted payment for services they did not perform, 2 ) they did not transfer the payment to the center ( if you believe the collection agent and law firm ) and 3 ) they did not refund my payment.

I got a phone call from Procollect Inc in XXXX XXXX about a debt that I did not know. This debt is based on the leasing contract of the apartment that I have never lived. I thought it was scam and ignore it. But I got a mail from this company in XXXX XXXX. After checking my credit record, I found that it was appeared in my credit record in XXXX XXXX. 

I requested Procollect Inc to send the proof showing I owed this debt in XXXX XXXX. They sent a leasing contract between DTN management and the person who had a similar first name and same last name, and went to the same University to me. However, that person is a clearly different person from me based on the full name, gender, passport number, and student ID and degree based on the record in the contract. 

I sent a letter stating that I am not the person who owes that certain debt with a proof ( a copy of my passport ) in XXXX XXXX via certified mail. However, Procollect did not respond after that. 

Now I find that the name of the person who made the contract with XXXX was added to my credit record as XXXX of my names and this debt is still in my credit record ( as in XXXX XXXX ). My credit scores have been dramatically decreased since they called me.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I vacated " XXXX '' before the lease expired. I gave 60 days written notice as requested. When I received the final bill from them, they charged me {$1100.00} for improper notice. They also charged me {$200.00} for final water bills. I was current with rent and water at move out. My water bill never exceeded {$35.00} per month and I hand carried the 60 day signed notice to the apartment manager. I have a copy of this notice. I requested copies of the " final '' water bill and disputed the improper notice charge. No proof or copies of the water bill were ever sent to me and no reply was sent about the improper notice charge. They just turned it over to ProCollect in XXXX, Texas and they promptly listed the charges on all XXXX credit bureaus. After disputing this collection with all credit bureaus, XXXX XXXX removed it. XXXX and XXXX did not. ProCollect has not yet sent me requested proof of the the above documents. 

I am now filing a law suit against ProCollect for reporting false information on my credit report.

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/XXXX ( and XX/XX/XXXX ) I received automated voice calls from Pro collect a collection company representing a former landlord. The automated messages were left on my cell. I called and spoke to an representative who then transferred me to another " supervisor '', XXXX XXXX. I told XXXX XXXX that I had received a call from this number, and she only confirmed my name. I only ID my name, and then she goes into it being a debt for the landlord, and provided the mini Miranda. Never verified last four of SSN and/or DOB. Provided the balance of the account. She asked had I received correspondence about the account, and I told her no. I confirmed my current address at that time, and never confirmed that this was the best number for me. I did explain twice that the number was a cell line, and she states that basically that meant nothing. She goes into providing me a phone number for her directly, the account number, and describes the methods of paying. She asked which one I would choose, and I explained that I would call back in. XXXX XXXX advised me that she would report my account as a " refusal to pay '' because she did n't give that ( meaning calling back ) was an option. At that point I identified that I being a former collector, and well aware of the laws, know that she could not do that. She was argumentative and at this point I terminated the call.
_source.issue: Written notification about debt

I received a voice message this morning on my home phone, XXXX, from ProCollect, Inc., XXXX, TX, a debt collection agency. The caller requested that I return their call at XXXX. I have not and will not do so. 

Alleged debt of {$120.00}, as noted in a letter from ProCollect on XXXX XXXX XXXX, is for repairs to purported damages to an apartment I shared with XXXX other occupants. I responded to ProCollect by letter dated XXXX XXXX XXXX that that I disputed the charges claimed by XXXX, the lessor. In my letter, I stated that some of the purported damages were noted as pre-existing on my move-in report ( which XXXX XXXX has failed to provide ), and I disputed the existence of others. I requested a move-in joint walk-through from XXXX when I occupied the premises on XXXX XXXX XXXX, and a move-out walk-through was also requested on XXXX XXXX XXXX. Both requests were denied. My XXXX roommate who was still in the apartment on XXXX XXXX also requested a move-out inspection on that date, and was also denied. Since there was no documented joint agreement on the premises ' condition at move-in, and refusal to do a joint inspection at move-out, XXXX unilateral claims as to damages are without merit. I also requested refund of my security deposit in the amount of {$100.00}.

_source.complaint_what_happened: In 2012 I went to the Emergency room for a XXXX XXXX and was treated by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX was under contract with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX at that time. XXXX did not turn the claim into the insurance company in a timely manner, and the claim was denied. Per their contract, XXXX was not allowed to bill me, the patient. Instead of writing the amount off the books, the balance remained but they did not bill me. Later, XXXX sold their Accounts XXXX to ProCollect. ProCollect refuses to acknowledge the paperwork that proves that I do not owe the debt. I sent a copy of the EOB from my insurance company with a code ( XXXX ). The XXXX page of the fax is the back of the XXXX which explains a code " ( XXXX ) You do not have to pay this charge. That is because the provider did not send the claim to us within the required time limit. ( XXXX ) ''. The have put a collections entry on my credit report and have been sending harassing letters and making harassing phone calls. I made several attempts to resolve the issue and in return received abuse and zero cooperation. The would not give me an original invoice or any contact information other than company name for the original charge. Through my own research I was able to get the whole story from XXXX XXXX insurance company. I will also be reporting ProCollect to the FTC for XXXX and FDCPA violations. The phone abuse went all the way to the top. I even spoke to XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX of ProCollect. He immediately began yelling at me over the phone and talking over me. Thank you very much for your assistance.

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XXXX/XXXX/XXXX both my son and I were contacted on our cell phones with a message left by Pro Collect, Inc. On the same day, we returned the call and were advised that they were collecting {$50.00} for an unpaid charge from XXXX XXXX in XXXX , SC ( an apartment complex where my son had lived and moved at the end of his lease on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX ). I explained to the Pro Collect representative that the charge was in dispute because the touch up paint work ( which is what the {$50.00} related to ) had not been done. Pro Collect would not note the file as in dispute on " refusal to pay '' and threatened a " hit '' and " ding '' on my credit report as well as my son 's if payment was not received by XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. This was only 3 days from the date of contact. Asked for something in writing - was told that would take 5-7 days but I still had to pay within the 3 days. Pro Collect would not fax nor email the requested written information. Pro Collect representative said " well we mailed a letter and must have been sent to a wrong address ''. But the representative could not verify to me what address the letter had purportedly been sent. I have been in touch with the apartment complex to sort this out, but so far have not been in receipt of any substantive information. Only been getting the run around here to. I have had to pay the {$50.00} plus {$7.00} collection fee via credit card today via Pro Collect website because of fear of credit reporting issues. I am appalled at the extortion that this company uses to collect funds. They refuse to work with you even when you are above board and NOT avoiding the calls or issue at hand. All I wanted is for Pro Collect to annotate the file as disputed to enable me to again follow up with the original credit for resolution of the issue.
_source.issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I have been receiving collection letters and telephone calls from ProCollect, Inc., XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX, telephone no. XXXX, since last year, on a debt I do not owe. 

I have had multiple telephone calls with the staff of this company, the most recent on : 1 ) XXXX XXXX, XXXX at XXXX with XXXX XXXX, 2. XXXX XXXX, XXXX at XXXX with XXXX XXXX and today, XXXX XXXX, XXXX at XXXX. with a supervisor, XXXX XXXX. 

In XXXX XXXX I had a medical emergency which required me to visit XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Texas XXXX. Before going to the Emergency Room, I checked with my XXXX Provider ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) to verify if the hospital was considered " XXXX '' on my plan. They confirmed the hospital was an " XXXX XXXX '' provider. 

During the admittance process I read all the forms provided to me by the hospital before signing them. 

Several months later I received a bill for services sent by the Emergency Room doctor. I called the hospital and was told the bill was for certain services, which were separate from the hospital bill, as the Emergency Room physicians were considered outside independent contractors not covered by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Such information was not disclosed to me by the hospital at the time of admittance. 

I asked the hospital to provide me with the forms I signed during my admission to the hospital including any form where I was informed by the hospital staff that the Emergency Room physicians were not XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX " in-network '' providers and that I was agreeing to be responsible for paying any services provided by such physicians that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX would not cover. As we went thru the forms, the hospital acknowledged that there was no such form, that I had not been informed by its staff that the Emergency Room physicians were not XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX " in-network '' providers nor was I required to pay for any services provided by such physicians that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX would not cover. I was the told by the hospital that they would take care of the fee and I would not be held responsible. 

During multiple telephone conversations with the ProCollect staff, I explained the above facts and requested XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX to provide me with any documents in their company 's possession proving that in XXXX XXXX I agreed to pay for medical care provided by " out-of-network '' physicians in the Emergency Room, which would support I owed the subject creditor the amount of {$230.00}. 

To date, I have not received the documents I requested from this company. On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, the company sent a piece of paper, without any letterhead, with my name and a an amount written. There is nothing in this document that proves I owe a debt. 

In light of their failure to provide the evidence of debt I have requested on multiple occasions, I ask that ProCollect stop sending letters, stop calling me by telephone and to delete this debt from any credit bureau to which they may have reported it. They have failed to do so and have continued a pattern of continuous harassment by mail and by telephone, even after I had specifically requested them, by phone and in writing, to stop doing so. 

Your assistance will be appreciated to resolve this matter and put a stop to these illegal and unfair debt collection practices. Thank you. 

Respectfully, XXXX XXXX XXXX
_source.issue: Cont'd attempts collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I was a tenant at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX. I actually only was a tenant for a month. I moved with permission and I continued in good faith to pay the rent though I did not live in the apartment until a suitable tenant was found. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX suffered no loss from this and I paid thousands for a property I did not live in. The company sent a claim to collections out of the blue, in XX/XX/XXXX - more than one year later - and claimed that I owed them a penalty payment that was written into the contract for breaking the lease. Some kind of reletting fee that is extremely excessive and is very unfair to the tenant as the tenant has no choice but to sign and approve all of the terms presented though they are clearly taking advantage of people and their position as a landlord. Most of all, I was told by the property manager that I would not have to pay this obviously outrageous charge of almost {$1000.00} as a cancellation fee. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX parked this debt after verbally telling me that I would not have to pay for it and has taken advantage of their position and my health condition. I contacted the property and spoke with XXXX XXXX who said she could not help me. She referred me to XXXX XXXX and I contacted her on XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX with no response. I wrote a certified letter on XX/XX/XXXX. I was ignored. I sent an email to the company 's general counsel XX/XX/XXXX and he didn't bother to contact me. I spoke with Ms. XXXX briefly on XX/XX/XXXX and0 she assured me that she would look into it and has refused to call me back though I called her to follow up and request a letter of deletion on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. This has very negatively affected my credit, very negatively impacts my ability to rent an apartment in the future and it is grossly unfair for them to park the debt and just put it on my credit without recourse. I have worked very hard for the last 5 years to keep my credit score up despite many medical problems and bills etc. XXXX XXXX XXXX has carelessly damaged my credit, my ability to rent a property and they absolutely refuse to give me the courtesy of calling me back. They are unprofessional and predatory and they should be investigated for their taking advantage of tenants. 

I have had very severe physical illness for several years and despite my health and financial challenges, I did the right thing and paid this company

This should be removed from my credit because I do n't owe your company anything. I did not sign a contract with millennium financial if you can provide me a signed contract that I signed with your company I will not continue with these dispute efforts. I have not elected to hold a contract with your company, and have no obligation of payment with your office. I am responding to your contact about collecting a debt. I would like for your company to provide me with competent evidence that I have a legal obligation to pay you. Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent in pursuant to the Fair Debt Collections Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( B ) that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. this is not a request for verification, or proof of a mailing address, but a request for validation in pursuant to the above named title and section.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
