_source.complaint_what_happened:
We moved out of our apartment in XXXX. We left the apartment immaculate, even cleaning behind the oven and vacuuming our way out of the apartment. 

Several weeks later the apartment management presented us with a bill for " repairs '' that was full of mistakes and most of the items included were false and/or in violation of the Texas Property Code. In other words, almost all the charges were for things we either did n't owe or were for things that they could not charge for by law. 

We attempted to resolve with the apartment management, but they refused to remove the wrong / illegal items. Instead they sent it to collections. 

This is causing us serious financial and XXXX. We are in the process of closing on a house and the closing is held up because of the disputed collection on our credit report. Additionally, this is causing us to incur higher interest rates and fees and will cost us thousands of dollars. 

The collections agency filed a collection on our credit reports. We have attempted to resolve via the proper channels : XXXX/XXXX/XXXX : we sent letters to the XXXX credit bureaus per the FCRA to dispute the information and request them to validate the data. All XXXX responded that they investigated and that the creditor says it was valid. When called to discuss, the credit bureaus said " you need to have the collection agency remove. We just ask them if it is valid. '' XXXX/XXXX/XXXX : we sent a letter to the collection agency per the FCRA and FDCPA asking them to validate the data. They replied that the creditor said it was valid and sent us copies of the lease and the form showing the illegal/wrong charges. They provided no proof. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX : we sent a letter to the collection agency per the FCRA and FDCPA stating that what they provided was not proof. It also clearly stated what was incorrect or illegally reported, and requested they remove the improper charges and remove the collection from my credit reports. They replied on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX that the creditor contends the charges were valid and resent the same information from their previous letter. No proof was supplied. 

XXXX/XXXX/XXXX : we sent a letter to the XXXX credit bureaus per the FCRA to inform them that we asked the collection agency to validate the debt and remove if incorrect, and that the collection agency could not do this. We requested they remove the collection or we would file a complaint with the FTC and/or pursue legal action.
_source.issue: Disclosure verification of debt

_source.sub_issue: Not given enough info to verify debt
_source.issue: Disclosure verification of debt

_source.complaint_what_happened: Back in XXXX of 2014 I moved out of my apartment at XXXX XXXX in XXXX Ga. About 2 weeks later I received an eviction notice through the mail at my new residence which I found very odd. When I arrived at court house on the court date, the clerk informed me that XXXX XXXX had dropped the case because they received the keys a week earlier. This also struck me as odd because I left the keys in the drop box in an envelope with my name and unit number on the front as I was instructed. Fast forward a few months later and Pro Collect is sending me a bill for {$1800.00}. When I disputed the account they sent over copies of the eviction notice and other documents to validate the account. The date the eviction was served the apartment had been vacated for 2 weeks. The letter also stated that I moved out without proper notice. So according to XXXX XXXX I moved out and was evicted simultaneously! But I gave them both verbal & written notice. <P/>After explaining the various issues I had with the property, ( including not removing the person who broke into my apartment because he was not on any lease, and the XXXX / eggs that were thrown on my vehicle on multiple occasions, and the XXXX that was rubbed all over the bathroom walls at the pool ), the manager on site became very agitated and told me that it was not part of her job description to handle those things. <P/>Three weeks later I noticed that my rent payment had not cleared so I called the front office and I was told that the check had bounced due to insufficient funds and I would have to pay a {$50.00} return check fee ( there is a sign in the office that says the return check fee is {$35.00} ). When I called my bank they assured me that the check had never even been processed. They also advised me not to pay the return check fee until I got the check back. <P/>I then made a phone call to XXXX XXXX and spoke to a guy named XXXX who told me he would resolve the matter. Minutes later he called back and told me he spoke with the manager on site and that my check was ready. When I went to the front office the manager told me the check was not there, that it would come through the mail. After arguing with her for 5 minutes or so, she opens a drawer and pulls my check out. The manager on site lied straight to my face and showed her true character. I returned to the bank and got a cashiers check and paid they rent that way so there was no more confusion. <P/>I was completely moved out of the apartment on XXXX XXXX, 2014 and have documentation to prove this. I was instructed to leave the apartment key in an envelope with my name and apartment number in the drop box which I did. Weeks later I received an eviction notice in the mail. When I went to the court house on the court date, the clerk told me that XXXX dropped the case. This was done deliberately to make it look like I was evicted instead of moving out. Since living at XXXX XXXX I have had to deal with shady managers that make up their own rules. When I moved into the apartment I was told the security deposit was {$250.00}. Shortly after moving in I received a notice from the then manager XXXX, that I owed an additional {$100.00} because the deposit was {$350.00} and not {$250.00}. I called XXXX XXXX and they confirmed that the deposit was {$250.00} so apparently the manager XXXX was scheming an extra {$100.00} off new tenants. <P/>So I was told the security deposit was {$350.00} instead of {$250.00}, then the return check fee was {$50.00} instead of {$35.00}, on top of being told that my check bounced when it was never even processed. This is very unprofessional of XXXX XXXX and reflects badly on XXXX XXXX.
_source.issue: False statements or representation

_source.complaint_what_happened:
in XX/XX/XXXX, I divorced my then, wife, now ex-wife. In XX/XX/XXXX, my ex-wife using an insurance card she was permitted to use, incurred a debt with a XXXX XXXX ; which, she promptly, failed to pay. 

The doctor 's office tried collecting the debt, eventually calling me since she had moved out of state. I informed them that I was not ther individual in their office ; nor, did I at any time agree to be financially liable for her visit. The doctor 's office indicated that they understood and never called me again. 

At some point thereafter, the doctor 's office sold off the debt to ProCollect. After not finding my ex-wife, they began harassing me. I told them the full story numerous times over the past four to five years. On more than one occasion they indicated they would remove the debt from my credit only to leave it in place and deny our previous conversations. Most recently, in XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke with a XXXX XXXX at ProCollect and after a lenghty discussion, she agreed that this was not my debt ; and if I could send my divorce decree as evidence, the smudge would finally be removed. 

I quickly drove to the courthouse where my divorce was finalized and paid for a certified copy of the requested decree. I then had the document scanned into PDF, again at my expense, and e-mailed it to the address I was given. 

This item has yet to be removed from my credit. 

I called ProCollect again today, in hopes of getting them to correct their apparent inattention to this issue, this time speaking to one XXXX XXXX. _source.complaint_what_happened: I rented a apartment from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX. After a few months of residing there, I have to move back to XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX. So I terminate the lease and pay the penalty which is {$5800.00} the remainder of the balance owed. Then in XX/XX/XXXX I got a call from XXXX XXXX saying that I owed them utility bill of a hundred and fifty something dollars. I call the utility company XXXX and ask about the charges and was told my account is paid in full and has been closed. Then I call XXXX XXXX and told them about my account standing with the utility company but they insist I owed them monies. so I ask for proof of bill but nothing came. After a while I start getting calls from the collection agency " XXXX Pro-Collect ''. I explained to them what happen but was told to sent in proof. I did by regular mail but still got calls from them on my cell phone. Then I spoke to a XXXX XXXX from the agency and she told me they did n't receive any mail from me. I proceed to sent them a registered mail this time but calls continue coming in. I call the agency and ask why are they still calling me and was told they are waiting for reply from their client but at the meantime they will keep calling. Then the last thing I know my credit report has a negative collection report.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
This is a complaint for the debt collector company- ProCollect.

I had resided in an apartment for 1 year and was charged a XXXX cleaning fee after moving out. The apartment complex, XXXX XXXX  XXXX, located in XXXX, Arizona did not send me written correspondence outlining the fee that was owed. In the move out notice it explained that the fees would be processed and mailed to the forwarding address on file once I moved out. I was waiting for this to be mailed to either myself or my mom as she was the cosigner. Since we received no correspondence in the mail, I expected no further charges were due. 

In XXXX I received two automated voicemails claiming to be a debt collection agency and that it was an attempt to collect debt. Two more voicemails were left in XXXX. I have been waiting for mail correspondence from the debt collectors as they must contact me in writing within five days of contacting me. 

Recently I was going though my voicemails and decided to give the number a call back. They had barely any account information only that it was from XXXX XXXX  XXXX and it was in my name. They were unable to accept payment and told me I had to email someone to obtain further information. They told me that in order to find out more information Mr. XXXX at ProCollect needed to take the restriction off the account. 

ProCollect -- the debt agency -- has not contacted me in writing nor is willing to cooperate over the phone regarding money owed. 

I ask for this company to prove that I owe money -- in writing -- and provide a secure means for me to pay the balance. I want it to be sent to both my mother and I as my mother was a cosigner on my account and should have been notified as well.
_source.issue: Written notification about debt

_source.complaint_what_happened: I received a settlement letter fro m ProCollect Incor porated stating they are offering me a settlement of 50 % off the total amount that I owe on the account they have from the creditor they are representing, Landings at  XXXX   XXXX   XXXX   XXXX  . Additionally, the letter stated that if the settlement amount, which is {$60.00}, is paid by  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX  , they would delete from my credit reports. The letter also states that the payment can be made via online at  XXXX . I made my payment online on  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX  , and received a confirmation email that the payment has processed. However, I received a telephone call on  XXXX / XXXX /  XXXX   from a representative  from ProCollect stating th at the payment did not process because settlement payments can not and are not to be made online which is totally different what it is indicated in the letter. I was also informed that they could not take my settlement payment unless I paid for another account that I have with them. This stipulation is not indicated in the letter either. Therefore, the payment I submitted was not processed and the settlement offer indicated in the letter was rescinded even though I complied with the terms set forth in the letter. Additionally, I was informed that even though they sent me a letter for a settlement offer on the other account, which I did not receive, because I did not receive the letter I could not have the settlement and would have to pay the full amount of the second account.     They are committing fraud and deceptive collection practices. The money was and is readily available for the account which I pay on  XXXX   XXXX ,   XXXX   and the terms set forth in the settlement and deletion from credit report letter should be honored. The account which I paid was  XXXX . I have supporting documentation.

_source.complaint_what_happened: First off, Pro-Collect used my application supplied to the apartment complex to call my dad ( in XXXX ), which they are not allowed to do. They advised him of my debt and called him so many times he had to block their number. Mind you, he was not co-applicant, he was just listed as a reference. Second, I called to pay my debt and the representatives are rude, disrespectful and condescending. Never in my life have I dealt with people who so unwilling to help. After the fifth phone call I finally was able to speak with a supervisor who was unwilling to remove my debt off my credit report as requested, which I do understand is a courtesy, but I paid my balance in full. When I asked why she said because I said so and that she was hanging up on me. Their tactics and representatives are awful and they should never be allowed to operate.

I found that I had a collection account on my credit report in XXXX of XX/XX/2014 The name of the original creditor is XXXX XXXX XXXX APARTMENTS. I called XXXX XXXX XXXX APARTMENTS when I discovered this collection account and was told that I did n't give them a 30 day notice. I explained to her that I have a copy of my 30 day notice but she said I need to deal with the collection company ( PRO COLLECT ). I sent a letter to PRO Collect explain that I do not owe the debt and sent evidence showing that a 30 day notice was given and the debt is invalid but they responded with a letter stating that their client contends that the debt is valid with no explanation on how the debt is valid. I need help dealing with this corrupt collection agency. They clearly know that I do not owe this debt but are trying to collect anyway. The lease ended on XXXX XXXX. XX/XX/2014 and I gave them a 30 day notice on the XXXX of XXXX XX/XX/2014. A staff member signed and made a copy for me. 
The XXXX is for {$1100.00}. 
{$600.00} for XXXX 's rent ( which makes no sense, since notice was given ).

_source.complaint_what_happened: I attempted to contact the regional supervisor over the property, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, that is claiming the debt against me via fax and phone on multiple dates over the last two months. The first attempt came on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, after trying to contact the parent company XXXX XXXX on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and was directed to resolve the issue directly with the regional manager. I contacted the office again XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. Every time I was told this individual would call me back and never did so. I sent over a fax the last week of XXXX and received a confirmation that it was delivered successfully. I have also attempted on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, XXXX/XXXX/XXXX and again XXXX/XXXX/XXXX through both phone and fax between these dates to provide documents which prove that a debt is not owed and none of these parties will consider the evidence that proves this, instead I have received forged documents that have copied my original signature and applied it to a document that I was never in possession of. I had a lease for a one bedroom apartment with a clean move-out checklist that showed now charges were due and no repairs needed made to the unit, but the document they provide that claims I owe a balance is for a two bedroom apartment. I did not rent a two bedroom and I have the clean move-out checklist/zero balance bill to prove it. Pro collect has contacted me repeatedly and refuses to provide me with proof that the debt is owed, instead only sending billing statements which claim my balance is due within a day of receiving the billing statement. I have provided evidence and they have confirmed receipt but will not accept it as a zero balance and they refuse to provide any proof that I actually owe the debt following my faxed dispute. They are trying to collect a debt that they are not owed and I can provide the document to prove it, which I have provided them on numerous occasions. In addition to billing me incorrectly after claiming I owed nothing after a walk through of the unit followed by the signing of the move-out checklist with the zero balance, they failed to provide me a copy of the bill they chose to forge within the 30 days they had to do so as outlined by Ohio Statutes.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX I called the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ) at XXXX and asked to speak to the property manager. I was informed by the office staff member that the manager XXXX was unavailable at the moment. I told them that I would call back. I decided to go to the XXXX  and speak with XXXX instead of calling back. Once there, I asked XXXX if there was some way that we could work out a settlement for the {$1400.00} that was owed to the XXXX  from XX/XX/XXXX. She stated the collection company ProCollect - has the account and if I work out a settlement with them to let her know. She gave me a number to contact them on XXXX. At XXXX I called and spoke with a young lady who claimed to be an account manager. She stated that they already sent me a settlement letter on XX/XX/XXXX for {$730.00}. I stated that is incorrect, I have never received a letter and I would have most certainly paid a 50 % off settlement. She claims they did. I asked to speak to her supervisor and she puts me on hold. She them comes back to the line and says her manager said no settlements, no payments. I again, asked to speak to the manager and this girl said that they were too busy to talk to me. I asked for the supervisors name and she said it did not matter because they were all going to tell me the same thing. She was putting me down as a refusal to pay and that the balance was due in 2 days. I asked what will happen to me if I dont pay it she said its due in 2 days. We hung up and I called the owners of the XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX and spoke with XXXX. She said that the general manager would call me back and see if there was something that could be done. I advised her that would be great. 
On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I called XXXX XXXX because I had not heard from the general manager yet. Again, I spoke with XXXX and she said she would find out what happened and call me back. At XXXX am XXXX called me back to let me know the general manager was in a conference and would call me back on Friday ( XX/XX/XXXX ). At XXXX on the same day the XXXX  property manager, XXXX, called me and we discussed the issue. She said she would call Procollect and work out a settlement with them ; we spoke for 3 minutes. At XXXX, XXXX called me and said before she calls them she wanted to know what settlement I was able to pay. I told her I had planned for {$820.00} ( my paycheck ) but since ProCollect offered the settlement in XX/XX/XXXX for {$730.00}, I could definitely pay that ASAP. XXXX said, ok, between XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX dollars?. I said yes maam. We spoke for 1 minute. 
On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I called XXXX at the XXXX to ask her if there was a settlement reached. She said the collection agency will call you and hung up. At XXXX I called ProCollect at XXXX and spoke with XXXX XXXX. She said there was a settlement that she just got emailed to her for {$1000.00}. She then asked me if I had received the settlement letter yet. I stated that I had not and that amount did not sound right. She gets loud and rude with me. I tell her that I will have to speak to someone else and hang up. At XXXX I called proCollect at XXXX and spoke to XXXX XXXX an account collections manager. She stated that she did see the settlement and she gave me all of the information that I needed to mail a money order in. I advised her that this settlement did not sound right as thats not what we ( XXXX and myself ) discussed. She said she will try to reach out to them and put me on hold. She comes back to the line and says that she can not get them but that she would work on it the rest of the day and Monday XX/XX/XXXX. She gave me her extention and I asked if she would be the one to call me before XXXX XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX because everyone I had spoken with was extrememly rude. She said yes. She will call me back on Monday. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a call from a Procollect collections agent at XXXX advising me that the settlement was for {$1000.00}. I advised them that I was waiting for XXXX XXXX to call me back as she is working on the account. I hung up. I called the XXXX at XXXX and was advised that XXXX was busy. I then called XXXX XXXX at XXXX and left a message with XXXX to please have the general manager to call me back. At XXXX, XXXX from the XXXX called and said that corporate decided the settlement not her. 
On XX/XX/XXXX I called ProCollect at XXXX and spoke with XXXX XXXX. For 9 minutes he refused to let me speak to XXXX XXXX, demanded my debit card information, and repeatedly put me on hold. He claimed that the XXXX  had no control over what I pay because the account is in HIS office. He said that I couldnt speak to XXXX XXXX because the account is updated and anyone can help me I didnt need to speak to her. I asked him what day the settlement letter was mailed out for this settlement ( since I was told previously that there was one ) and he said they dont send out letters. He would not give me any information without screaming it at me. He stated that I could send a money order in by regular mail but if it wasnt there by XX/XX/XXXX that the whole balance would be due. I obtained the mailing address and my account number. He hung up on me. At XXXX I contacted XXXX at the XXXX extremely upset and crying. I advised her what XXXX XXXX said and she told me that he was spouting nonsense. It took her a minute to get me to calm down as XXXX XXXX upset me severely by the way he was speaking to me. She told me to send the money order the way I had planned regular mail, certified. She told me to keep a check on the money order and when they cash it to check the balance there. If it was a balance left that they were trying to charge me, to let her know and she would take care of it from there. At XXXX, I called ProCollect back to update them on what XXXX had said to me and was once again speaking to XXXX XXXX. Again, he screamed at me and was obnoxiously rude. He was very loud and aggressive towards me. He demanded that I send the payment overnight or through XXXX XXXX. He again said that the full balance would be due after XX/XX/XXXX. I advised him that I was going to do what XXXX told me to do. He continued to put me on hold and when he would come back to the phone he would be loud and aggressively rude again. I verified the account number and address again and told him that I was very glad the calls were recorded and I hung up. 

On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX I called ProCollect and again, I was transferred to XXXX XXXX. He advised me that since I did not pay the settlement by XX/XX/XXXX that the full balance ( {$1400.00} ) was due. He then demanded my debit card information and stated that I could pay through XXXX XXXX. I advised him that I was calling in to let them know that I was mailing the {$1000.00} money order today. I asked him to verify the account number and address again. He refused. I asked several times and he wouldnt verify until I started speaking the account number. I asked him if they would send me a receipt do I need to include a self addressed stamped envelope? He said they do not accept any mail and that he would mail my money order back to me. I told him to have a great day and I hung up. At XXXX I called the XXXX and left a message for XXXX that I mailed the {$1000.00} settlement money order to ProCollect by certified mail. I also asked the office staff to please let her know that XXXX XXXX said he was going to mail my money order back to me if it was not the full amount. The office staff said she will definitely let her know.

_source.complaint_what_happened: Recently, I discovered that a collection agency named ProCollect had reported a collection balance on my credit report. Prior to the account appearing on my credit report, I never received a notice of my right to dispute. I contacted the company to file a complaint about not receiving a notice of my right to dispute prior to the account appearing on my credit file, but they did not remove the account from my report. This is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.     Additionally, I requested that Pro Collect verify the debt they were trying to collect by sending me a copy of the original signed lease as well as a detailed monthly pay history on this account, which clearly demonstrated where this supposed debt originated. The did send a copy of the lease, but they have not sent me a detailed explanation of how the {$1500.00} debt they are trying to collect was calculated. That is also a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.     And finally, I also reached out to ProCollect about setting up payment arrangements should this debt ever be verified as legitimate. Their representatives informed me that they would not accept payments from me.  Reporting  a debt on one 's report, and refusing to accept payments towards the resolution of the debt is also a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.
_source.issue: Written notification about debt

_source.sub_issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt

_source.complaint_what_happened:
1. Debt collection, about the move-out charge for bed 2. I solved the issues with the rental company before already, but they keep letting debt collector contact me for the money, and now they denied we solved the issue before. 

3. Dear CFPB : Thank you so much for taking the time to read all those and helping me. 
Two years ago, I lived in XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX, XXXX XXXX- three bedrooms house. During the staying, I switched houses in between, so I lived in two furnished houses with this company for around two years and never had any late, missing payment or damage ever. 
When I ended the final lease with XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, after I graduate. 5 days later, my sublease started to enter the house on XXXX XXXX ( my roommate left the door open for them to enter no matte when they officially move in ). They removed the bed from the room to the living room because they have their own bed ( I revisit the house on XXXX and lived in my friends room XXXX for one night, so I saw with my own eyes, the bed was good downstairs ). 
My room was supposed to be inspected before the sublease move in. When new people move in, new people and company will do inspection together as well. I did not receive any notifications about any damage charges after I moved out and before the sublease moved in. So I assumed there were no damages. But around one to two weeks after the sublease moved in, I received an email from the office, saying there was a {$120.00} damage charge on the bed with photo token sent after sublease moved in for weeks already. If the damage was caused by me, they could find out during inspections and send to me during the inspection period. But the damage was reported to me after other people moved in already and after all the previous inspection period past. Therefore, I called the office about it, the office said it didnt make sense, not to worry, they will take care. So I didnt worry, trusted them, didnt ask any emails to confirm and let it go. 
Around XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( dont remember when ) I keep getting debt collectors phone calls to ask me for this money ( at this time its not on my credit record ). I was shocked. So I called the office again for the situation and the collector issues, the girl who picked up my phone put me on hold talking to the higher manager, and then tell me not to worry again, they will contact the debt collector about it, might take some time but they will handle it. I should remember her name and ask her to send me a confirmation email but I didnt. XXXX me This XXXX I saw my FICO score started to drop for the reason of the presence of derogatory public collection. I thought they need some time for FICO to take it down and my father past away so I was busy handling my family and myself, didnt keep tracking the progress. But now the note is still there, so I feel there is something wrong. I called XXXX XXXX again today, this time was different girl picked up my phone, denied I solved the issue with them before, asked me for writings from office to prove and saying I have to deal with the debt collector, once they hand the case to collector, it is out of their hand and refuse to discuss the damage issues with me. 
I have XXXX credit cards for years with perfect records, my highest FICO score was above 800 for months. Rented a few apartments, never late or miss any payment. If I should pay, I will never refuse to pay. If it was not them told me I don't need to worry, I won't let any payment be this late to show on my credit record. I paid everything for my life for the amount much greater than this {$120.00}. I have no reasons to delay any payment for two years I am always XXXX student in school, been on XXXXXXXX XXXX for the entire college. I promise with my own life that it was not me causing the damages in the first place, and I didnt mean to delay or avoid any payments. Everything I said above is the whole truth and nothing but the truth. Despite my daily life is ruined by hundreds of phone calls from a debt collector, my credit history is ruined because of it. I am so worried that my future will be negative impacted by this because I know how important a perfect credit history is. Its the first time I face such a situation ; I really dont know what to do now. Please help me. 
No matter what, thank you so much for everything. I sincerely appreciate all your time and helps. 
Sincerely yours, 4. XXXX at XXXX XXXX Address:XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX PA XXXX Phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX 5. Don't know I am bad at names ; I didnt deliberately remember or write down their names who talked to me. I am so so sorry. 
Debt collector : PROCOLLECT , INC Phone Number : ( XXXX ) XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX

_source.complaint_what_happened: Someone rented 3 apartments using my identity. Procollect, inc. requested I gather the information they needed to delete the account. At first I was told I needed to file a police report. After I sent them the documentation with the report number, they reached out and told me that I had to send a copy of the report. I got all that finally and mailed it to the address they told me. Then they told me after they had received the documentation that it had to be sent in electronically and they refused to process it. Finally, I got them to process it and after 3 months of the account being processed I reached out to them and was told that it had to be reviewed by the original debtor and they were waiting. So I called the debtor and they had not received anything. After over a week of trying to get a supervisor to speak with me I finally talked with him and he told me it would be placed in " Managerial Review '' and it would remain open but not reported to the credit bureaus. He lied. It is STILL on my credit report and being actively reported. So I called them again after it reported and they said that I did not provide them with enough information, even though I provided them with everything they requested. This is an unprofessional company and will not remove an account even if they KNOW it was opened fraudulently.

They informed me that XXXX turned it over to them for either not paying the last month of rent or not giving written notice to leave the apartment unit. I was a resident at XXXX XXXX and moved out and was then sent a bill over {$1000.00}. I had no idea why. I contacted XXXX XXXX and was told that the apartment complex was under new management and owners and they had no knowledge of my debt. I asked for the former owners information and they were unable to provide me with that. The amount then went to collections and I corresponded with the agency to find out who owns this debt so I can figure out whats going on. They would n't release any information but stressed the fact that they did not own, they were only collecting the debt. After a few back and forth, I ignored them because it was going nowhere. Fast forward to XX/XX/XXXX, I started repairing my credit and this debt comes up again. I signed up with XXXX XXXX and they acted on my behalf to clear deliquent things off my report. The collection agency once again sent a notice stating the debt was valid but the information I got which was apparently submitted from XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, was false. The employee forged information and submitted fees for stuff that I never knew existed. She claims I moved because I got a pet which was false. She also changed dollar amounts on paperwork to reflect a ridiculous amount of charges. I contacted the agency and they told me to contact the company who submitted the debt ( XXXX XXXX ). I contacted them once again even though I knew what the response would be. Email response below : XXXX XXXX XXXX ; XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX To XXXXXXXXXXXX Message body Hi XXXX I am sorry you are having such a hard time resolving this matter. The company that currently owns and manages XXXX purchased the property XX/XX/XXXX. We do not own your debt and would not have access to your records. I do not know who owned the property when you lived here. 
Sorry I can not be of more help. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX Property Manager XXXX Apartments XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX visit us at XXXX I am stuck and going back and forth with XXXX XXXX and the collection agency. I hope that I can get more information as far as who owns the debt and who I can dispute this amount with. The false claims really are what have me in a bind.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Subject : Assistance to deal with landlord / XXXX XXXX agency 's harassment, coercion and threats. 

Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : We are in urgent need for assistance from your agency to deal with a series of harassment calls and fraudulent, derogatory credit reports that I and my daughter have been facing from the debt collections company, ProCollect Inc, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX. 

We need your help to resolve this issue since our position is very clear on this subject and we have communicated the same, repeatedly to XXXX   XXXX XXXX as well as the debt collector agency listed above. The frequency of harassment calls have increased ever since we filed disputes with the credit bureaus and obviously since they are a hired agency, they have no interest in learning about the facts of the case. 

The facts are as follows : a ) TENANT IN COLLEGE STUDENT HOUSING : My daughter was a college student at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX University and rented an apartment with another student at XXXX XXXX, Texas at XXXX XXXX XXXX. I co-signed the lease ( XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX ) as a 3rd party guarantor. 

b ) The rent was diligently paid on-time by my daughter and the apartment was well kept and fine till XX/XX/XXXX. Even XXXX  XXXX XXXX will testify to that fact. 

c ) My daughter 's roommate ( another tenant ) had allowed her brother to illegally stay in the all girl 's apartment from XX/XX/XXXX. He was not a legal renter at apartment and pretty much lived in the apartment which was leased out to the 2 girls only. It was very uncomfortable for my daughter and she repeatedly complained to the roommate and XXXX XXXX XXXX management from XX/XX/XXXX. 

d ) NO ACTION TAKEN DESPITE REPEATED COMPLAINTS : XXXX XXXX XXXX local site management did nothing, except saying " we will look into this ''. The relationship between my daughter and her roommate deteriorated considerably as a result of the repeated complaints. The XXXX XXXX management were repeatedly asked to do something - they did nothing. 

e ) ROBBERY & BREAK-IN : On XX/XX/XXXX, my daughter 's bedroom in the apartment was broken into, her laptop, purse and several items were stolen and a male sweatshirt was left on her bed as a warning. A police report was filed, Case # XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Texas and based on police recommendation that there could be a threat to my daughter from bodily harm, my daughter 's mother and I asked her to immediately vacate the apartment promptly. 

f ) POLICE RECOMMENDATION : XXXX XXXX XXXX Police Department assigned detective, Detective XXXX, ( I can provide his contact number if needed ) to the case as well. My daughter immediately vacated the apartments, handed the keys to the local XXXX management, informed them of the police report and the break-in. 

g ) ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMPANY : The landlord 's behavior was simply shocking - they were more concerned about rent money and lease, irrespective of what happened and their own negligence in evicting the illegal renter from the premises. Even though, the apartment was vacated on XX/XX/XXXX, she paid rent for the full month of XX/XX/XXXX and had to find a place to rent in the midst of the semester. 

h ) XXXX XXXX XXXX management kept harassing my daughter with phone calls and emails about breaking her lease violations and insisted that she had to pay for the remaining 2 months rent ( $ XXXX/- total ), even though as landlords they failed to provide a safe, secure environment and despite knowing that it was because of their own inaction this situation had escalated between 2 roommates and an illegal male renter was comfortably occupying the place. 

i ) XXXX  XXXX XXXX management started harassing me for the lease violation and threatened to damage my credit as a guarantor. I warned them to keep away from my daughter as she was in the midst of her term exams. The emails and phone calls continued. I asked them to challenge us in a legal court, which they have refused. 

j ) They hired a debt collections agency to harass us. We filed a detailed response to the debt collection agency, ProCollect about the situation but they could not be bothered about the police report, break-in and robbery. In XX/XX/XXXX, the debt collections agency filed a fraudulent derogatory report on our credit score with all major credit reporting agencies. The problem with these debt collection agencies is that they don't get paid if they are not successful in coercing consumers in paying, even though the debt may be fraudulent.

The account manager, XXXX, even accused me of taking over my father 's debt, saying I am now responsible for it. I did not sign any paper to assume my father 's debt, and XXXX could n't produce XXXX. I have contacted the hospital too, they sent me a letter apologizing for their mistake. Their business office, according to them, has contacted ProCollect so they can correct the error and XXXX the hospital assured me that ProCollect promised to fix the error which has not happened. 
I am writing to please beg and implore to help me with this situation. I can still open new credits but with less favorable terms. I want to shop for auto and home insurance but I get less favorable quotes because my credit score plunged from XXXX to XXXX. _source.complaint_what_happened:
Received a phone call from debt collector - ProCollect Inc - in XX/XX/XXXX which I ignored because I thought it was a scam. I have no debt and I have never had any debt. 
Subsequent calls were discussed with my parents who told me to ask for the details to be sent in writing. Internet search of ProCollect revealed they did collections for a number of apartment complexes nationwide. I assumed this may be the result of my last student housing from XX/XX/XXXX. 
Answered a call from ProCollect on XX/XX/XXXX. Asked what they were calling about - debt collection - and I requested verification and creditor name in writing. 
Received a letter from ProCollect dated XX/XX/XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Creditor was named in the letter and it was my student apartment complex. I called the Creditor and attempted to discuss the issue with them. Specifically, why absolutely no communication directly with me or my roommate, nor even an attempt to reach us by phone or mail. They refused to discuss the matter with me and would not provide any documentation. They said we needed to deal with the debt collector. 
Responded with my own letter to ProCollect dated XX/XX/XXXX disputing the validity of the debt and requesting documents which, specifically define and describe the event ( s ) which caused the debt and copies of the documents, including receipts, descriptions and photographs. I also requested copies of maintenance records specific to the unit during the time period of our rental. There was significant damage from a plumbing leak in an adjacent unit which required repairs to our unit while we were tenants. In addition, company representatives were replacing doors and the bathroom tub/shower unit as we were moving out of the unit. We asked for photos of the " damage '' supposedly done by us. 
Received a letter from ProCollect dated XX/XX/XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX containing their file contents which consisted of " Move Out Statement '' from XXXX XXXX XXXX with the list of damages, but no details. Its language looks like it should have been presented to the tenants. This never occurred and would have been strenuously objected to if it had. Also contained copies of the front page of the Rental Application and the first page of the Lease Agreement. The Rental Application included my phone number, my email address and my home address. The Creditor made no attempt to contact me at any of these. 
I responded with another letter to ProCollect on XX/XX/XXXX detailing neither ProCollect nor the Creditor had presented any evidence a loss or debt was caused by our actions. I expected the Debt Collector to get the evidence from the Creditor because they would not speak with me. 
Received another letter from ProCollect dated XX/XX/XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, which was exactly the same letter and contents as the XX/XX/XXXX letter. 
I responded with another letter to ProCollect dated XX/XX/XXXX expressing my understanding that they were having difficulty getting the Creditor to provide my requested information and documentation, as they would not communicate with me either. I also mentioned we would wait until they were successful in obtaining the information. 
I have received no further communication from ProCollect. 
In XX/XX/XXXX I was unable to obtain a credit card to be used for business travel purposes for my new job. I assumed it was because I had no credit history because I have never had any debt. 
It was suggested by some friends that I request my credit reports. I was unable to do so with any of the credit agencies online through annualcreditreport.com and was told by the websites to request the reports using the Annual Credit Report Request Form. I sent the form to all XXXX agencies. 
Only XXXX provided a report. It contains a negative file from ProCollect which I have disputed. XXXX told me they only respond to Creditors and I need to " win '' my issues with them. They told me to contact the CFPB.
_source.issue: Cont'd attempts collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XX/XX/18 Dear Sir or Madam : This letter of complaint is related to Procollect Inc., XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX, XXXX, Related to my account # XXXX. Procollect is trying to collect an incorrect amount on the debt. I had an initial debt of {$450.00}. I agreed and established that the debt was valid and I have been paying on the debt as often as two or three times a month. Procollect is not reporting payments to both credit bureaus. The two bureaus have different information about what I owe, which negatively impacts my rating. I submitted moneyorder receipts and asked all agencies to investigate my evidence and make the corrections. XXXX ( Complaint # XXXX ) and XXXX credit reporting agencies have erroneous amounts owed on my reports. 
I have gotten the debt down to {$220.00}. I check my XXXX XXXX account regularly to insure that my payments are being credited and received. I made the monthly payments without specifying a particular amount to be paid each month ( contract ). I am on a fixed income of only {$850.00} per month right now. I did not want to go into default on the debt, if unable to pay what I had agreed upon. I filed a complaint with XXXX  related to the incorrect balance noted on the report ( Complaint # XXXX ). I made sure to write both XXXX and Procollect and ask them to update my list of payments, using the information and copies of moneyorders. They have refused to do so. XXXX stated that they had investigated and say that I now owe {$260.00}. This is a {$37.00} difference from my calculations. The XXXX report states that I currently owe {$360.00} which is way off the mark. 
I am constantly receiving notifications ( from XXXX XXXX ) that my credit is being damaged because ProCollect is not giving me credit. What my records show I owe and what Procollect is reporting to the credit agencies is NOT correct. I sent Procollect copies of my payment receipts ( which they are  ignoring ). The balances between the two credit bureaus are inaccurate. I have made two efforts to dispute the incorrect information. I made copies of the postal moneyorders I mailed to Procollect plus the dates they were mailed out. Neither Procollect or the credit agencies properly investigated or updated the  information. The only thing I asked them to do was to tell me which payments they HAD received from me ( using the list that I provided ) and to let me know which ones were not credited. Inaccurate information is being kept on my credit record even though I have provided proof that I had made these payments. If I am to pay off the rest of the debt, I EXPECT to be fairly audited and that no more derogatory remarks be placed upon my account UNTIL I receive confirmation and validation for the payments I have made. I do not feel that it is fair for me to have to pay {$5.00} to research missing money orders or to have to certify EVERY single moneyorder that I send by mail. 
The credit bureaus and Procollect are not accurately reporting or confirming my payments. I need all organizations to update my credit files and to cease the marks until a resolution is made. Thank you! Questions ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX.
_source.issue: False statements or representation

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Procollect is worse than an extortionist! After reviewing my report, it has a debt in collections that I was NEVER informed about until XXXX which is 2 years as of now. XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a XXXX letter, but received an offered to pay a 50 % in XX/XX/XXXX. After I received the pay 50 % in XXXX, I called to remove because it is invalid and I didnt receive any validation letter. I told the lady in XXXX, I sent a validation letter, she said they sent it but they only sent a pay 50 % letter. She then said I couldnt even accept 50 % offer, I HAVE TO pay the full amount THAT DAY. They are also reporting XX/XX/XXXX the date of the 1st delinquency, WRONG. Tried to let her know that this lease was terminate for safety issues. She said she could no longer help me, I was refusing to pay and hung up. In XXXX, sent another letter for validation ( confirmed received XXXX but I have not received. XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted once again. Spoke to the foulest, impolite, bad mannered XXXX XXXX. Calling to resolve a debt. I tried to explain to XXXX XXXX that the property manager and I, agreed in front of the authorities at the time of departure due to safety and security issues. What did I need to provide because termination was via email after a verbal agreement. I couldnt finish, she interrupted I DONT CARE ABOUT YOU SAFETY OR SECURITY, you can go back to the client but they will refer you right back to us. If its your lease, its yours. Im marking this for refusal to pay & hung up. I tried to call again. Maybe a new rep is polite. I called again. I spoke with callous, impolite XXXX XXXX. I tried to inform her that it was agreed on via email but she stated I had to have a lease showing a zero balance. The authorities were involved and I wanted to ensure what I had on file was enough. All dates per information I have reflect around the same dates. All were involved because of the living condition issues since I moved in, by the time my car was vandalized every water facet had XXXX surfacing and flooding the kitchen and bathroom. XXXX then said oh yeah well HONEY I cant help you, thats a personal problem that I could CARELESS ABOUT, if you cant prove it then you owe the debt and YOUR REFUSING PAYMENT, I no longer have anything to say to you. Why it took two years and a validation letter before I received anything, to be aware. Her answer, I am placing you on hold, your refusing to pay. Please have them submit the calls to prove that complaints are REAL. Once again no help but I called again. XXXX XXXX, I inform him about the rude reps and I just want to know what I needed to provide to them that was sufficient enough. He then stated that he could not help me, demanded a payment in XXXX days, in full {$640.00}. When I sent validation letter in XX/XX/XXXX, I only received a pay 50 % letter in XXXX. He said they sent the validation letter but when? Ive been trying to resolve this for 5 months, NO HELP. The property manager is no longer there but I will try to have them confirm. XXXX XXXX says the same thing as XXXX XXXX " You can call them but they will send you back to me '' Again, really! How can a company who has NEVER contacted me, and Ive been the one initiating resolving this matter now refuse to just simply consider that the debt may be in error, only will note " REFUSAL TO PAY '' & intimidate the consumer by telling them you have 3 days to pay OR ELSE! He said wasnt concerned with anything I had, he will only take another signed lease, I sighed the lease and I have to pay PERIOD. If theyre referring the info that we provide to their clients for review, then why cant we? Where is the customer service? I also received an email per Procollect and they recalled the email and I no longer have it. 
In accordance with Fair Credit Reporting Act Section FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681g I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all of the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of the request concerning the accounts that you are reporting in my credit report. Please send me copies of the documents that you have reporting on my credit report that were used to validate accuracy of physical records of the accounts listed on file of original signed account or contract from any account posted on my record. I am also requesting a copy of the agreement/contract with wet ink signature, a copy of the accounting records and a copy of the process used to validate the mention debt. I have never had a lease contract with Procollect but XXXX Apartments terminated my lease. They stated that I owe two months rent but the balance is {$640.00} and rent charges were {$520.00}. My remaining balance should have reflected a total of XXXX plus the additional charges. This is false.I am following up w/ XXXX XXXX, Texas & NC attorney general 's office, FTC , CFPB, and anybody else to complain about its rude, unprofessional, insensitive employees and extortionist business practices. They will not honor my dispute and they are maliciously reporting accounts to the credit bureaus. They are bullies.

_source.complaint_what_happened: NEVER received proof that debt belongs to me or that I agreed in writing to pay ProCollect. ProCollect reported to the credit bureaus a collection account that is fraudulent and frivolous in nature. Be advised this is a notice that your claim is disputed and validation is requested immediately. Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) /FCRA, I have the right to request validation of the debt ProCollect says I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt to ProCollect. This is a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. I request that your offices provide me and CFPB with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay ProCollect. At this time I will also inform ProCollect that if their offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by ProCollect or the companies you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against ProCollect and their client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character. My consumer rights attorneys and your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put ProCollect in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I require 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. All items of collection added to credit bureaus must be removed. Also during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my attorney to continuing filing suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If ProCollect fails to respond to this validation request within 3 days from the date of this complaint, all references to this account must be deleted from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION pursuant to FDCPA/FCRA laws. Please provide the following ( please note all items must be completed and original forms no copies ) : Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he/she agreed to pay the creditor and agreement that alleged debtor agreed to pay ProCollect ( in its entirety with debtors signature in writing ). Any insurance claims made by any creditor regarding this account. Any Judgments obtained by any creditor regarding this account. Name and address of alleged creditor. Name on file of alleged debtor. Alleged account number associated with original creditor. Address on file for alleged debtor. Amount of alleged debt. Date this alleged debt became payable with contract agreeing to payment signed by alleged debtor and ProCollect Date of original charge off or delinquency from original creditor. Verification that this debt was assigned or sold to collector. Complete accounting ( ledger/statements ) of alleged debt on original creditors books and ProCollect books Commission for debt collector if collection efforts are successful. Please provide the name and address of the bonding agent for ProCollect in case legal action becomes necessary. Your claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of the above is not completed and returned with original documents. This is a request for validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and FCRA guidelines. Please allow 30 days for processing after me and my attorney receives the requested documentation.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

I lived in XXXX XXXX from XX/XX/XXXX- XX/XX/XXXX after just returning from XXXX . I am an XXXX XXXX XXXX in the United States XXXX. In XX/XX/XXXX I received new orders and began the move out process, I gave them a hard copy of my orders and had email traffic ( at the time ) with the manager at the time named XXXX. He examined my apartment and told me to have the carpets cleaned. He gave me the phone number for the company they use and I paid almost {$200.00} for the carpets to be cleaned. He never got back with me, so I took that as an understanding that all was okay. In XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from the current manager that replaced XXXX saying that I owed a debt, I informed her of the situation and she confirmed she saw the email traffic. I let her know that I would only speak to corporate and to refer me immediately. After unanswered calls and emails, I again thought all was taken care of and sorted out. I then just received a letter in the mail dated XX/XX/XXXX saying I owed even more. I am so confused, I called the collection agency and they threatened my credit, yelled out me, berated me, and told me that if I didnt pay today it would noted as a refusal and they would report me. They told me I could take a payment plan, but that the plan would only be available today. They then began to tell me they accept Visa and MasterCard. I have tried countless times to get in touch with the Apartment Complex, none of these charges are warranted. I have not lived in that apartment complex for almost a year and half. They have had my contact information this entire time. 
The Collection Agency is called ProCollect and I believe it to be a scam. I have undergone XXXX  XXXX just this year already and I was just able to go collect my mail after an emergency XXXX XXXX, they told me I have until XX/XX/XXXX and then they will destroy my credit.

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/XXXXat XXXX XXXX  I contacted Pro Collect Inc concerning a debt that reports on my my credit report from XXXX XXXX XXXX. I asked for proof of the debt and I was sent a ledger from Pro Collect. I did not receive a copy of a lease or proof that they were trying to collect a valid amount. They did not send anything with my signature on it to prove that i had a valid debt or contract from XXXX XXXX XXXX. They informed that they sent letters that was never received concerning this account. The ledger is not a signed document to prove that this is my debt nor does it show the valid amounts according to any lease agreement that binds me to this debt. This situation has been going on for over a month and I have still haven't received any follow. The letter that accompanied the ledger stated that their client the OC contends that this is a true and valid debt. This being on my credit report is not only messing up my credit but it is preventing me from receiving credit from potential lenders. I need this information removed from my credit report because it violates my rights and it doesn't show any validity of any debt or any correct amounts. How could I owe {$790.00} For rent, {$670.00} for reletting fees, {$790.00} for termination fees, {$740.00} for damages like trash, cleaning, misc., paint and locks plus rent in the amount of {$790.00} for each month from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX that's almost {$2400.00} and late fees of {$450.00} totalling {$5800.00} with No such proof. How could I move out in XX/XX/XXXXand owe all of this money before I even moved. Not my debt and this debt is not valid. I am demanding that it be removed because my rights are being violated and demanding a contract with my signature that says I agreed to pay this or a agreement with my valid signature.

_source.complaint_what_happened: ProCollect reported to the credit bureaus a collection account that is fraudulent and frivolous in nature. Be advised this is a notice that your claim is disputed and validation is requested immediately. Under the Fair Debt collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) /FCRA, I have the right to request validation of the debt ProCollect says I owe you. I am requesting proof that I am indeed the party you are asking to pay this debt, and there is some contractual obligation that is binding on me to pay this debt to ProCollect. This is a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( b ) of the FDCPA. I request that your offices provide me and CFPB with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay ProCollect. At this time I will also inform ProCollect that if their offices have or continue to report invalidated information to any of the three major credit bureaus ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), this action might constitute fraud under both federal and state laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found or continues to report on any of my credit reports by ProCollect or the companies you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against ProCollect and their client for the following : Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and Defamation of Character. My consumer rights attorneys and your legal staff will agree that non-compliance with this request could put ProCollect in serious legal trouble with the FTC and other state or federal agencies. If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following declaration, I require 30 days to investigate this information and during such time all collection activity must cease and desist. All collection added to credit bureaus must be removed. Also during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my attorney to continuing filing suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit-reporting repository that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If ProCollect fails to respond to this validation request within 5 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. CREDITOR/DEBT COLLECTOR DECLARATION pursuant to FDCPA/FCRA laws. Please provide the following ( please note all items must be completed ) : Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he/she agreed to pay the creditor and agreement that alleged debtor agreed to pay ProCollect ( in  its entirety with debtors signature ). Any insurance claims made by any creditor regarding this account. Any Judgments obtained by any creditor regarding this account. Name and address of alleged creditor. Name on file of alleged debtor. Alleged account number associated with original creditor. Address on file for alleged debtor. Amount of alleged debt. Date this alleged debt became payable with contract agreeing to payment signed by alleged debtor Date of original charge off or delinquency from original creditor. Verification that this debt was assigned or sold to collector. Complete accounting ( ledger/statements ) of alleged debt on original creditors books and ProCollect books Commission for  debt collector if collection efforts are successful. Please provide the name and address of the bonding agent for ProCollect in case legal action becomes necessary. Your claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of the above is not completed and returned with original copies of all requested documents. This is a request for validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and FCRA guidelines. Please allow 30 days for processing after my attorney receives the requested documentation.

_source.complaint_what_happened: In XXXX of 2013 my wife and I moved out of XXXX XXXX XXXX after successfully completing our 8 month lease. Recently while attempting to qualify to purchase a home, we were informed that there was a collection account on XXXX of our credits that was derived from our lease with XXXX XXXX XXXX. Somehow after we moved out there was either a miscommunication or a huge mistake on someones part because we left XXXX XXXX in good standing. We had no idea that we would have this account in collections because we were never informed that we owed anything to XXXX XXXX. The collection agency that owns this " debt '' is ProCollect out of XXXX TX. When we submitted a request for proof of debt from ProCollect, they mailed us paperwork that included entirely false information. They claim that we owe {$320.00} from an outstanding balance with XXXX XXXX, however, their paperwork does not match our original paperwork. Thankfully we have held on to our deposit receipt from our move-in to XXXX XXXX which shows that we paid a much larger deposit than what ProCollect is claiming we paid. ProCollect claims that we paid a {$500.00} deposit, however, our deposit receipt states that we paid a {$980.00} refundable deposit. The information that ProCollect sent us is absolutely false and manipulated. We have gone to XXXX XXXX in person and they validated that the deposit receipt we have is authentic. We have also attempted to contact XXXX XXXX numerous times which was who managed XXXX XXXX when we lived there. We have not been able to get in touch with XXXX XXXX but we are certain that they would also agree that ProCollect is being deceptive in their attempts to collect this " debt ''.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
According to Section 392.101 of the Texas Finance Code prohibits a third-party debt collectors or credit bureaus unless the third-party debt collection or credit bureau has obtained a surety bond & filed a copy of the bond with the Office of the Secretary of State. ProCollect Inc.is illegally trying to collect debt from me & has illegally reported an alleged debt to all three credit bureaus. 

SUBCHAPTER B. SURETY BOND Sec. 392.101.  BOND REQUIREMENT. ( a ) A third-party debt collector or credit bureau may not engage in debt collection unless the third-party debt collector or credit bureau has obtained a surety bond issued by a surety company authorized to do business in this state as prescribed by this section. A copy of the bond must be filed with the secretary of state. 
( b ) The bond must be in favor of : ( 1 ) any person who is damaged by a violation of this chapter ; and ( 2 ) this state for the benefit of any person who is damaged by a violation of this chapter. 
( c ) The bond must be in the amount of {$10000.00}.
Acts 1997, 75th Leg., ch. 1008, Sec. 1, eff. XXXX XXXX, 199
7.
Sec. 392.102. CLAIM AGAINST BOND. A person who claims against a bond for a violation of this chapter may maintain an action against the third-party debt collector or credit bureau and against the surety. The aggregate liability of the surety to all persons damaged by a violation of this chapter may not exceed the amount of the bond.
Acts 1997, 75th Leg., ch. 1008, Sec. 1, eff. XXXX XXXX, 1997.

XXXX XXXX XXXX, ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Acct # XXXX & Pro Collect ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Acct # XXXX. XXXX XXXXt XXXX is collecting the debt for {$1700.00} Pro Collect is collecting for {$1700.00}. _source.complaint_what_happened: In XXXX XXXX an apartment I moved out of was retaliating against me for some disagreements the property manager and I had to do with repairs in my unit that they refused to fix (law violation  #1) and towing vehicles. I did not renew my lease with them however, upon giving proper notice of intent to vacate, I somehow acquired a lump sum of charges (XXXX) that I was never informed of (law violation #2). For the record, I was first notified of the charges on XXXX XXXX XXXX by the debt collection agency ProCollect, 2 months after moving. The claims made against me were clearly made in bad faith. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX submitted no evidence to support their allegations and instead the credit bureaus and debt collections agency let a mere copy of the lease agreement constitute as evidence. I sent multiple dispute letters claiming the false statement of fact provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. On XXXX XXXX XXXX I sent Pro Collect a final dispute letter with attachments that refuted all of their claims against me. I received nothing back from ProCollect but now this is the only derogatory mark on my credit and it is completely illegal. ProCollect has violated the fair debt collection practices act. Section 807(5) States that a debt collection agency cannot threat to take action that cannot legally be taken. Section 809(b) States that if a consumer notifies the debt-collector within the thirty day period (a) that a debt, or any portion thereof is disputed, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I was robbed at gunpoint while at college in an apartment that I was placed in with other occupants based on profiles we each filled out. The apartment employee, XXXX, placed me with XXXX people he had wrestled with in a room that was down the hall from my friends. We each had our own bedroom/bathroom that locked in each apartment. The kitche/familyroom & washer/dryer were common areas that were shared by all. The XXXX gunmen that entered the apartment were looking there for another tenant that XXXX wrestled with and knew. This roommate had been in drug treatment facility and was a known drug dealer. I had just meet these people & had only known them for 3 weeks. My wallet was taken, my laptop, my new iphone 5 & games from my room. They locked us in a bathroom and left. We waited and then all went to other friends apartments and called police. Nothing was recovered, the police investigator said the XXXX gunmen were XXXX and they would not prosecute because they would just get out. We had pictures of them from cameras outside our entry door. The apartments kicked the XXXX guy out because it was his fault. They offered to move me and the other roommate to another apartment if I wanted to. I was scared and said I would rather go home. I arranged through the Dean at school to finish my classes at home. The apartments fired the lady over operations at the facility and a few other people because of all the problems with issues on property. The gate was never closed, doors left open & not secured, fights, etc. Police were on property XXXX times the XXXX weekend I was there. XXXX XXXX from the apartments corporate office in Indiana said that was okay and I left by XXXX XXXX, 2014. No one ever sent me anything, nor did they tell me I would owe anything. I did not receive anything until the end of XXXX 2014. My attorney sent them a letter and they said they would take care of it. Now, I start getting calls from a collection agency??? I have ask them to contact my attorney and given them his information several times. They continue to call. They have been very rude to my mother and even cussed on the phone, which we have recorded on our answering machine that was recording the conversation. The males who have called were nice, took the information but then we were disconnected. The females ( all but XXXX & there have been several ) are extremely rude, have cursed & are not professional at all.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Company in question : ProCollect Inc, XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX : ( XXXX ) XXXX I have been called continuously to provide credit/debit card information. I have been making payments through money orders and XXXX. This company had tried to collect a debt that I owe to an apartment complex. When first contacted about the debt by XXXX XXXX ext. XXXX, i was immediately asked to provide debit/credit card information to make payments on the amount owed. After I declined to provided said information, it was agreed upon that I would be able to make payments via money order or XXXX. On XXXX XXXX, 2015, I sent a money order in the amount of {$100.00} dollars which they received and cashed. 
Nearly a week later, I was contacted by a different representative and asked again for credit or debit card information to make a payment. I again declined to provided that information for my next payment. On XXXX XXXX, I mailed in another payment for {$100.00} which was cashed on XXXX XXXX a week later, I was contacted again by XXXX XXXX asking for credit/debit card information and my next payment. XXXX XXXX alleges that they did not received the payment that was cashed on XXXX XXXX. I sent in proof of payment and asked her why I have note been receiving monthly statements of my owed balance after making payments. She simply brushed me off. In frustration, I asked if there was another way that I could provide payment without putting a card on file. XXXX XXXX and I agreed that sending a XXXX would suffice since they are affiliated. On the same day of our conversation ( XXXX XXXX ), I sent a XXXX with XXXX XXXX on the phone and verified the reference number for my payment. XXXX XXXX verified that the payment would be processed. Again, I asked her again about receiving a monthly statement in the mail. XXXX XXXX stated that they are not " obligated '' to provide me with a statement. A week later, I received yet another phone call from yet another representative again asking for credit/debit card information to provide payment. This representative even asked me to pay the balance in full during this call. Again in refused to put a card on file and ended the call. Ever since, I have been receiving phone calls XXXX times weekly asking for a credit card. I have never dealt with any debtor who refuses and declines my request for a monthly statement and refuse to send any more payments until I know that this is a legit and legal company collecting my payments.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Within the month of XX/XX/XXXX, I had officially graduated college at the University of XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, with a XXXX degree. Since I did not have the means or reason to continue living in my apartment, I made all necessary arrangements to be sure that I had moved out before the new year XX/XX/XXXX. 

I had been living at the apartment complex - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - all throughout my college career ( from XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX ). Within this time period, I had always paid my $ XXXX/mo rent on time and never received a late payment notification from the apartment complex. 

After I had moved out, on XX/XX/XXXX, I had received a " Move Out Statement '' from the apartment complex stating that I owed them {$3300.00} for cleaning fees, late fees and collection fees. 

The statement had explained that : I " have left owing XXXX XXXX XXXX a balance of {$3300.00}. This balance is due within 30 days of this notice. Any security deposit disputes will only accepted in writing. '' I was obviously confused at this because I had notified some staff members of my departure both prior to my graduation date, as well as on the exact day I had left and provided them with my key fob, mail key and all other property belonging to the apartment. 

Soon after I had received that letter, I started receiving phone calls from random people claiming to be from a collections agency. Then another. And then another. One call after the other, each " agent '' claiming that if I had not paid my debt in full within 30 days they would put a derogatory mark on my credit ( which had only been established for 5-6 months at the time ). They had even sent a man to visit my mother 's house on 2+ separate occasions in the evening ( around XXXX-XXXX ) in order to physically claim this 'debt. ' As you can already imagine, my mother was terrified. 

After the phonecalls and the physical visits from people claiming to be agents, I had received another letter on XX/XX/XXXX, from a company called ProCollect Incorporated stating that I owe them a total of {$3300.00} ( which had broken down from the original {$3300.00} + a {$7.00} collection fee ). See the attached photo for copies of both this letter and the one received in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Once I had received my first official FICO score I noticed that my score was rated at a XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX, and then a score of XXXX in the following month due to a " derogatory public record or collection filed. '' Throughout the year I had been in the Midwest on a family mission to establish some investments for my mother 's company. Because of this I was unable to properly handle the situation in person ( neither had I known about the CFPB.gov at the time ). I did, however, make attempts to explain my situation to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX via phone call, to which they had explained to me that they had already filed with the collections agency, therefore there was nothing that they can do to help the situation ( this was ironic and discouraging to me, given that they were the ones filing the complaint ). Although I had been advised to NOT make contact with the agency, I had called them anyway to dispute my situation, to which I was prompted to either pay the debt in full or suffer consequences via derogatory remarks on my credit reporting ( this was in XX/XX/XXXX ). 

Since then, I have stopped receiving calls and my mother has stopped receiving unwelcomed visits, but I have had this mark on my credit, and I am seeking for it to be removed without it affecting my credit score any longer. 

I have never had an issue with this apartment for the entire duration that I lived there. Not ONCE, even when I had XXXX  and briefly XXXX there for my first summer job in XX/XX/XXXX, I did not have any issues with XXXX XXXX. No issues, until this whole situation had occurred last year.
_source.issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
