_source.complaint_what_happened: I was contacted by ProCollect regarding an apartment that I gave early notice to due to health and safety reasons among many others. I told ProCollect I didn't agree with the charges and they told me to fax them a letter of denial/appeal, which I did. I faxed this letter of appeal on XX/XX/XXXX. I called to check on the status of my appeal and was told by Ms. XXXX at extension XXXX that she didn't see my letter in the system yet but not to worry as it takes time to get put into their system for the collection agents to see that. She said they would call me back. Next call I get from Pro-Collect was from an agent that knew nothing of my appeal letter and didn't seem to be interested in looking for it so I asked to be transferred to Ms XXXX but was hung up on instead. I tried calling back but was rudely put on hold till I finally hung up as i had no more time that day to hold. The very next day I get an alert from XXXX XXXX that a collection was put on my credit. This company denied me my right to appeal this debt before damaging my credit. I am a good steward of my credit, and this is the only blemish I have and it was put there in denial of my rights. I am outraged that these companies are allowed to operate as if they make the laws, and people have no rights. I am sure that my rights have been violated. My appeal was never heard before damaging my credit for the next 7 year of my life. I can provide the appeal letter sent to them as well as proof of fax that I received showing it went through to them. As I am writing this, Pro Collect called again and care nothing of the fact that I sent them a letter of appeal. They are like robots that read a script and threaten you without actually listening to anything you say. Shame on these people, and shame on a system that allows people to be treated so poorly. I have excellent credit and have never defaulted on anything in my life. These collection calls are new to me, and I am now realizing how people are treated as if they have no rights. This is barbaric and has got to stop.
_source.issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action

ProCollect , Inc would NOT take the receipt from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ProCollect , Inc said that I would either have to mail it in or fax it to them. I did both, and after a couple of weeks I realized that the debt was still listed on 1 of the 3 bureaus. Coincidentally ProCollect , Inc called me this same day. _source.complaint_what_happened:
I discovered on XX/XX/XXXX that I had an outstanding debt in the amount of {$260.00} after it was reported to the credit unions. This debt was reported over two years after it had been sent to collections in XX/XX/XXXX. In that time, I received no written notice about the debt. I also received no phone calls about it. 

When I called the company to learn more about the debt, they stated that they would make a note that I refused to pay the bill because I insisted on seeing written proof of the debt before I paid for it. They stated on XX/XX/XXXX that they would send me written proof, which I have not received. 

I called to discuss the issue with a financial advisor, who advised that I pay the bill while not admitting that the debt was mine. He also advised me to ask for a letter of deletion to provide to the credit companies so the debt could be removed from my credit reports. I did as he advised when I called the collection company. They refused to provide me with a letter of deletion, stating that they would instead send me a letter stating that the debt was paid in full.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I moved into XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2017. I indicated on my application that I had a dog, and I also indicated what type of dog I had. My application was approved to move in. About 3 days later I received a call from the leasing office stating that they made a mistake with my application and the accidentally overlooked the dog. They explained that while pets were accepted my dog was too big and they have breed restrictions. I was asked to send in a copy of my dogs vaccine records, and proof of town registration. I did as requested. A few days later, I was contacted again by the leasing company and they told me if I dont get rid of the dog theyre going to evict me. I explained to them that the pet and her breed was listed on the original application, they approved everything, I shouldnt be subject to an eviction notice because of this. around XX/XX/2017 I received a notice to quit, shortly after on XX/XX/2017 I received an Eviction notice for unpaid rent. I went into housing court and filed a response to the eviction. I explained that I have always paid my property rent, and the unpaid rent they are attempting to take me to court for are unpaid PET RENT and a security deposit for the dog. The case went through mediation, the lawyer representing my apartment was present. I presented all of my rent receipts since occupying the premises. We attempted to come to an agreement, I asked for a lease for my dog before paying them the pet fees that I was recently made aware of. The leasing company refused to give me a pet lease. No agreement was made at the mediation process on or about XX/XX/2017. After returning to my residence the leasing company called the police and told them that my dog was violent and people felt threatened for their safety. The police officer explained to me that the leasing company was requesting for my dog to be removed from the premises. The police officer took a look at my dog, and his behavior, and he said he doesnt see a reason to remove the dog. The dog had a good temperament and is not causing a problem. After that incident I no longer felt comfortable in my apartment. I vacated the property on the weekend of XX/XX/2017. The keys were returned to XXXX in the leasing office. The apartment was left the same way that I received it. No damages were done to the property, and it was clean spotless when I moved out. I went back to court on XX/XX/17 to finish up the eviction process. The lawyer for the leasing company did not show up. The judge advised me that the case had been withdrawn without costs to any party. No judgement was ever placed against me. I was never evicted. My rent was always paid. Months later I check my credit report and a collection agency PROCOLLECT is charging me over {$3500.00} in falsified fees from the same apartment company. This is not my debt. I never received any notice of this item being placed on my credit report. I do not owe Procollect or XXXX any money. This case has been involved in litigation. The credit bureau XXXX has already removed this false debt from my credit report. PROCOLLECT needs to stop falsely reporting inaccurate information to XXXX  and XXXX. Take a look at the court documents that will be attached to this complaint, I do not owe any money. Procollect is ruining my credit score and degrading my character. I want this false information deleted from my credit report immediately!
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened: I was renting from XXXX XXXX XXXX owned by XXXX XXXX from XXXX to XXXX. At the time they were accepting Section 8 housing which I was currently eligible to receive. I had no problems from the first year of my lease. The second year when the problems came. Usually while on Housing they come and do an annual housing inspection to make sure the townhome is up to code to qualify for housing benefits. XXXX XXXX did n't pass inspection. So the state notified them when the next inspection would be and the time frame they had to fix the issue. Once again they ignored the request and failed inspection the second time. They received a notice that they did n't qualify to be on the housing program anymore unless I paid XXXX to have a 3rd inspection. I paid the XXXX to have it done because I did n't want to move out. When they did n't pass inspection the state does n't pay their portion of the rent. It also stated that I was not responsible for the states portion of the rent payment. XXXX XXXX received this notice. XXXX XXXX finally fixed the issue. XXXX XXXX attempted to collect the payment that Housing was responsible for from me. After showing them documentation and giving them my case worker number to talk to them they served me with an eviction notice. The landlord even showed up at my door on a non business hour stating, '' If I were you I would move out because the judge is going to kick you out anyway ''. I advised her I would stay until we settled in court. On our court date XXXX XXXX could not prove that I owed the money they were trying to collect from me. The judge advised me since I had 60 days left that I should go ahead and move out. I was fine with that. I asked the judge since I do n't owe any money this should n't appear on my credit background. She told me that they could not add it to my credit due to them not winning the court case. She gave me 7 days to move out. I was getting ready to sign a lease to my new apartment when they advised me that XXXX XXXX had placed on my credit report I owed XXXX. I had to prove to my apartment complex that I did n't owe this morning by showing them the paperwork from the court. I as investigated the matter XXXX XXXX had sold my debt to a company called ProCollect in XXXX Texas. They have been reporting to all 3 credit companies. I have faxed and emailed documents stating I do n't owe them money. They always say they did n't receive it. As I am repairing my credit I hired a credit counselor. He was able to get them removed from my credit but ProCollect keeps reporting as we keep fighting to keep having them repeatedly removed. ProCollect has went so far as to reporting to the IRS that I collected this money. So once again I had to submit my Judgement papers to the IRS to prove that I never owed this money. So now I have to walk around with all paperwork in hand explaining a debt that should have never been on my credit background.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I would like to file a complaint against Pro Collect for falsely reporting a debt to the credit bureau that we believe is not justified, also we never received notification that we owed any money from the complex. The first time we were made aware that we owed any money was months after we vacated the apartment complex. 
My husband received a call for the first time in XX/XX/XXXX from a credit collector. The person stated that we owed money and that if we did not pay the bill in two days from the date of his call that he would report the amount owed to the credit bureau. My husband stated that he was not aware of any money owed. The gentleman stated that we owed money for an apartment we vacated in XX/XX/XXXX. He said we vacated the premises early, broke the lease and was not available for a walk thru. He said that we had no proof that we did not vacate premises early. My husband reiterated that he was not aware of any money owed and that we did not vacate premises early and we paid any charges that were due before move out. My husband said that he would have to look into the matter and call back before he paid any money. The creditor repeated the charges were valid and that we needed to pay in two days. He hung up with my husband and then contacted my cell phone several times. 
I contacted the property we formally resided at to inquire about charges we owed I spoke to XXXX she said that she was an assistant manager. She said the apartment complex was under new management, so it would be difficult to answer any questions regarding the collection call we received. She was able to locate some records that noted that we owed money after we moved out. I informed her that everything was paid before we moved out in XXXX and if we owed any money why did n't we ever receive a phone call or letter. She said that we may not have received notification if we broke the lease and vacated the property prior end of lease. I told her that we did not. I contacted Pro Collect to inquire about the bill and told by a young lady that if I had a dispute she could not assist me she could only take a payment. 
We paid our final bill prior to moving out and spoke directly to a manager and office clerk that informed us that we did not owe anything. If they noticed later that charges were not calculated correctly and money was due, it was management responsibility to ensure that we received notice of what was owed. We never received any calls or letters about any money owed until months after we vacated from a collection agency. We would have gladly paid any money owed to the complex if they had contacted us. We do not want any blemishes on our credit report we pride ourselves on paying our bills in a timely matter. My husband and I will pay any money owed but the debt must be removed from our credit reports because it is not our fault that the property management failed to communicate to us.
_source.issue: Incorrect information on credit report

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/19 I filed a complaint about pro collect in search for something as simple as a receipt for a {$550.00} payment that was made on XX/XX/19. This morning a representative Ms XXXX I believe her name was called me in her attempt to rectify the situation. However she did not give me any option for a receipt my only options were to pay the balance in full for a paid in full letter or to use my statements. This is not an official receipt! How am I to prove that I have paid you or what my balance is on the account if I do not have a statement. the rep continued to ask me with her harsh tone if I wanted to cancel the payment plan that I did not want to set up in the first place but was told I had to because they do not accept partial payments it has to be on a plan. I told her if I can not receive a receipt or documentation on the plan yes please cancel. She then told me that my balance for BOTH of my accounts are now due in full. This is not fair as the account that had the plan has nothing to do with the other account as they are two separate accounts. This is an unfair attempt for retaliation and I think they need to be investigated for their policy and tactics as a financial collection service. I had not problem paying them back until I was told that I would not receipt the appropriate documentation until I give them all of the money. The rep then asked me if I have received any of their attempts to collect ( which she knows I did not because I changed my address in the system with her when I made the initial payment ) she then told me she can send a bill for the balance of both of the accounts to my address on file. You mean to tell me you can not send me a receipt or proof of payment but you can send me a bill and request for payment of debt?

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX ( EST ), XXXX XXXX received an automated call from ProCollect ( See pdf XXXX ProCollect Call Summaries. ) On XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX ( EST ), XXXX XXXX called back the message and spoke with a representative who was unable to provide much information regarding an alleged debt ( {$91.00} ) that XXXX XXXX owed and stated that written correspondence was generated and hung up on XXXX XXXX as he continued to try to obtain clarification about the alleged debt. XXXX XXXX immediately called XXXX back and spoke with a Supervisor who stated that XXXX XXXX owed an outstanding Debt from XXXX XXXX XXXX  despite him never having been sent any correspondence via US Mail or Email with XXXX XXXX XXXX  as he had corresponded with them hundreds of times in the past ( see pdf XXXX Previous Email Correspondence ). XXXX XXXX corresponded that he had had mail forwarding through the US Post Office ( see pdf XXXX USPS Change of Address Confirmation and XXXXUSPS Mail Hold ) to his new address and never received any correspondence from XXXX XXXX XXXX  about any outstanding debt owed. The Supervisor stated that the XXXX was allegedly mailed to XXXX XXXX at his old address, but she was unable to provide proof of returned mail nor explain why it was never forwarded to XXXX XXXX or sent to him at his email address like previous correspondence from XXXX XXXX XXXX. The Supervisor stated that verification of the Debt would be mailed by ProCollect to XXXX XXXX via US Mail. The Supervisor stated that the alleged debt was reported as delinquent on XXXX XXXX credit report by ProCollect. During both telephone calls, XXXX XXXX stated that he wanted all correspondence regarding this matter to be sent to him via email or US. Mail and not via telephone. 

On XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX ( EST ), XXXX XXXX received another automated call from XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX emailed ProCollect indicating again his 2nd request that ProCollect not contact him on his telephone number but rather only via email or US Mail ( see pdfs XXXX XXXX - ProCollect ( 2nd Warning re_ Telephone Calls ) and XXXX XXXX - Re_ ProCollect ( 2nd Warning re_ Telephone Calls ) Amended ) On XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX ( EST ), XXXX XXXX received a letter from ProCollect ( dated XX/XX/XXXX ) ( see pdf XXXXProCollect Letter ) alleging that he had an outstanding debt with Lease Term Insurance Group in the amount of {$91.00} and that ProCollect had been referred the account by the original creditor and that XXXX XXXX had 30 days from the date he receives the letter to dispute its validity. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX sent a letter to ProCollect via email and US mail ( see pdf XXXXProCollect Letter ) disputing the validity of this reported debt and request that ProCollect send me verification of the debt. XXXX XXXX also stated again that he requested all correspondence regarding this matter be sent to him only via email or US. Mail. 

On XX/XX/XXXX around XXXX ( EST ), XXXX XXXX received a letter packet from ProCollect ( dated XX/XX/XXXX ) ( see pdf XXXX ProCollect Debt Letter ) indicating that our client contends this is a true and valid debt and the attached is the information you requested. On page 7 of the packet, in a very difficult to read discolored page, it states that XXXX XXXX owed {$41.00} for Final Bill and {$50.00} for Cleaning Fees. It is also hand written on the page that on XX/XX/XXXX mailed to address here never forwarded. The remainder of the pages contained unrelated apartment lease documents which did not pertain to the alleged debt. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX submitted yet another dispute letter packet indicating that the information sent by ProCollect does NOT contain any information as the details of this reported debt. The only reference to this reported balance due of {$91.00} is on one page ( very poor quality see attachment ) of the numerous irrelevant documents sent and it merely states that there is a {$50.00} charge for cleaning fees and a {$41.00} charge for final bill. On the line above these charges, it is difficult to read but I believe it states, trash left in garage, clean toilet, bathtub, floors and kitchen pics attached. On this same document, it is handwritten that mailed to address here, never forwarded. XXXX XXXX further details I dispute that any bill was sent to me as I had a mail hold and forwarding to my new address from XX/XX/XXXX onwards ( see attachments ). I received numerous pieces of forwarded mail during the Fall of XX/XX/XXXX at my current address in Indiana but never received anything from XXXX XXXX. It is likely that XXXX XXXX XXXX did not actually mail any Invoice/Bill to me. Ironically, XXXX XXXX and I communicated periodically via email during my XX/XX/XXXX-XX/XX/XXXX leasing term but I never received any email regarding this matter. XXXX XXXX also had my telephone number, but I never received any calls or voicemails from them. The first that I heard of this reported bill is during my telephone conversation with ProCollect on XX/XX/XXXX. 
I am writing again to request the detailed bills for the cleaning fees and final bill. I dispute that these are valid bills for me as I never received them and still have not received details about what the bills are for. Regarding the reported cleaning fees, I took time stamped pictures of the apartment prior to moving out which proves that the apartment was in the same condition as move in. Regarding the trash that was left in the garage ; a representative from XXXX XXXX stated that the item would be taken to the local XXXX ( see attached email ). I look forward to receiving communication from ProCollect either 1 )  validating that this reported bill is frivolous and invalid or 2 ) the actual original invoice/bill for the final bill and cleaning fees that detail the charges assessed to me and the reasons they were assessed. The information sent by ProCollect on XX/XX/XXXX does not provide validation of the reported bill. 

As of the date of this CFPB complaint [ XX/XX/XXXX ], XXXX XXXX has never received any further correspondence from ProCollect but has continued to falsely report derogatory remarks on XXXX XXXX credit history ( see pdf XXXX ProCollect on XXXX XXXX )

_source.complaint_what_happened:
TO : XXXX XXXX & CEO/President XXXX XXXX Pro Collect/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Cc : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, New York XXXX Cc : XXXX 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX MD XXXX FROM : XXXX XXXX EMAIL : XXXX REF : Frivolous and Criminal Lawsuit DATE : XX/XX/XXXX Sir/Madam As a child of XXXX, as a young Veteran, as a XXXX XXXX Family Member, I must tell you your company received the wrong complaint. This is the complaint you all should have received. My uncle assisted me in this illegitimate, and unlawful collection predicament. He sent the complaint to the wrong company when it justly belongs to your unprofessional company. 
My uncle got involved when he found out Pro Collection Inc. employee made an ethnically  prejudiced assertion to me when I called your business. Just like you are sending me paperwork vis -- vis my lease. I am sending you a copy of my lease I signed with another apartment complex when I left XXXX. 
These two leases crossed each other after I gave XXXX my thirty days notice on the XX/XX/XXXX. I moved out two-week early. I even gave XXXX a copy of my new lease where I presently reside. Before you make shiftless extortions about a situation you scarcely know about, I can only educate you to be cautious. You agreed with XXXX on a lie without examining the facts maam, knowing those past employees are long gone. 
It seems to me, Pro Collect Inc. and XXXX need a human behavior course, and some racially  sensitive training to comprehend mere mortals intelligently, and temperament. Since you do not have evidence to support your falsehood. I will help you out. First, my work schedule would not permit me to move during business hours. I asked XXXX XXXX XXXX what should I do with the keys after hours. She instructed me where to put them, and I put them exactly where I was told. 
I left a message that night on the voicemail letting her know I did exactly what she instructed me to do. She never returned my call. I thought everything was fine. When I finally heard something about this incidence, I got a letter from Municipal Court that was forwarded to my new address. By that time, the court date, and the appeal process had passed. 
This begs more questions than answers. I called XXXX again to let her know that I have been gone from there for a while. She stated, they couldnt locate the key. I refreshed her memory regarding our conversation. She told me to hold on. When she came back to the phone after ten minutes or so, she said she found the keys and apologized. I asked her about the court situation. 
She told me not to worry and she would take care of it. I should have worried after looking back in regretful reflection. I got sued for {$2000.00} in court for KEYS I returned. I dont owe any money to XXXX. Why would I stay there when I had moved into another apartment complex? The XXXX of you maam to labor me as such, and corrupted my credit file where I can not get my V.A. loan. 
Evidently, this is an illegal sham with malicious forethought, or XXXX has some very bad bookkeeping problems. Either one leads me to believe that your collection company and XXXX are practicing a sense of criminality mixed with malevolent and foul intentions. However, these are the trickery and the foolery a leasing office plays with tenants. 
Especially, when they have the backing of a ruthless collection company that has frightening intentions to degrade and besmirched an innocent Veteran/XXXX XXXX Family Member under the faade of fair collection practices. 
Maam, you are more than uninformed, you are twisting the law as it stands. This makes you extremely dangerous! The federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) governs the behavior of debt collectors and debt collection agencies. It places limits on what you can do, or can not do in collecting a no owe debt from me. Unfortunately, despite the law, Pro Collect Inc. are still engrossed in these illegal collection tactics. 
I called your business, I carefully explained the whole situation to your employee, and she said, you people never do right. You people? This phrase has long been used as an interpersonal generalization toward one culture. It has become known as a XXXX sobriquet that targeted XXXX-Americans only. 
This racism has manifested itself in terms of individual behavior at Pro Collect Inc., and XXXX XXXX XXXX through hate with institutional behavior. This racism is propagated and publicized under the expert tutelage of XXXX XXXX & CEO XXXX XXXX, the overseers at Pro Collect Inc. This is a classic move of evil. However, one characteristic of evil, it contains a seed of its own destruction. 
I decided to bring this tragedy of injustice up this week for a reason. This week we are celebrating XXXX XXXX XXXX birthday, and this is coinciding with the boycott my uncle is planning against XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Georgia. Furthermore, injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere. 
I thank XXXX and give Him the praises by allowing my uncle to be a lifelong member, and a vice-president of the XXXX I am letting you know XXXX XXXX & CEO XXXX XXXX. We have reached out to XXXX XXXX with XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX. We will live stream the boycott through XXXX, and XXXX. I will let the world know Pro Collect Inc. had two years to right this wrong, or square this circle, and you stubbornly didnt, and you stubbornly wont. 
I will leave you with a quote from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity ( XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ). It is XX/XX/XXXX and the ghost of XXXX XXXX is alive and well.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
The company has contacted me repeatedly to attempt to collect a debt that I do not owe. I tried to reason with these people and they continued to lie and harass me. The rental application ( which I can submit ) specifically states that unless you pay the application fee, your application would not be processed. No application = no deposit and no hold on a unit. However, after I relayed this information to ProCollect, they yelled at me and accused me of not paying my bills. I requested that they no longer contact me until they send me proof of the bill and they did neither. I am still awaiting proof til this day. All they have ever sent me was a invoice that was sent to them! That 's not proof of me agreeing to pay a deposit or being forced into a apartment I did not put a deposit in for either! My application fee was returned because I accidentally was {$.00} short of the {$35.00}. I called the representative I was in contact with immediately and let him know of the situation and that I would have to wait until I could come up with enough to pay it in cash. He said " okay. '' That was the end of that! 

Until 2016. This year they found me and harassed me. It has stopped me from getting an apartment that would 've helped me out a lot. I am disgusted with the representatives and the company 's response in general! I want them to remove the mark on my credit report and stop contacting me about {$230.00} that I do not owe!

_source.complaint_what_happened:
About a six months ago, I received a dunning notice in the mail from Procollect , Inc, which is a third party collection agency located in XXXX, Texas. Apparently, this notice was sent in reference to an alleged debt that was created by a broken lease from XXXX XXXX XXXX, located in the same city. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I mailed Procollect, Inc. a letter requesting validation of this alleged debt in accordance to Texas Finance Code 392, which states that a consumer has the right to request full proof of the validity of a debt -- along with some kind of formal proof of contractual obligation which binds me to said debt ( i.e., a contract with my signature on it. ) Procollect, Inc. received my debt validation letter on XX/XX/XXXX ; and therefore, had until XX/XX/XXXX to furnish this information. 

About two weeks later, I received a response in the mail from Procollect, Inc., from what appeared to be an attempt at debt validation, but after full careful review of those documents ; unfortunately, they 've fallen short of the XXXX 's full validation guidelines.

_source.complaint_what_happened: This company started calling me last month about a debt that occurred 2 years ago from rental apartment. It just started to affect my credit report. Last month I started to receive constant calls from this collection agency about a debt that was owed to XXXX in XXXX XXXX, MI, which I rented on XX/XX/XXXX. I moved out 2 years later, and signed off without any problem or fee due. I lived in XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX for 2 years after my rent with XXXX XXXX ended. After signing off with the leasing office in XXXX, I received no mail, no email, no phone call or any sort of communication at all until Last month I Received calls directly from the collection company regarding a debt of {$610.00} about wall repaint, refrigerator replacement, etc, which I had no knowledge of for over 2 years. I only have the contract from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX in hand. But on the contract it clearly stated that " Landlord may use, apply, or retain the whole or any part of this Security Deposit to the extent required for the payment of any rent, additional rent or any other sums as to which the Tenant is in default including, but not limited to, any damage beyond ordinary wear and tear to the Premises, including the common areas, or its fixtures or appliances ''. And if any fee was occurred I should have been notified immediately since my contact information and other legal documents are on record. But leasing office did not inform me on anything, and we signed off on the day we moved out with no payments no residual security deposit owed to the apartment. In addition, I called the leasing office of XXXX XXXX, they refused to talk to me since they passed this case to the collection agency already. Then I called the collection agency about my case, and I tried to communicate with the representative : XXXX ( code:XXXX ), but he was rude and treated me with little respect and an attitude that he specifically told me multiple times repeatedly to " just pay your bills ok? ' I was surprised and shocked by his behavior when I was trying to understand him. He had no patience in listening to my explanation, and he refused to talk to me by keep saying " have a nice day '' and wanted to hang up as I was trying to understand what he was saying. I know my XXXX was not proficient enough to understand everyone word he said so quickly, so I asked if my boyfriend could try to talk to him and understand the subject. XXXX then specifically told me " no '', I asked him to send an email to me then, he also refused to do that instead he asked to him and understand the subject. XXXX then specifically with my boyfriend, he is selling his house on the market, I do not want to receive any paper letters from them that would bring damages to my boyfriend 's house sale or reputation. So I asked him over and over why he could n't send an email exaplaining this issue. He refused to give me a reason. I also asked him to send over evidence and bills from the apartment, he refused again by saying he can only send mails. He has no proof nor evidence to identify those damages to the rental apartment came from me or my roommate, for all we know, this could be anyone that later rented the apartment or the apartment 's own damage since my roommate and I specifically had nothing owed or billed and there was no problem when we signed off with the leasing office. This company 's conduct was unprofessional and inappropriate. The leasing office or the collection agency did not contact me for damages for over 2 years. I suddenly received such an amount of debt that is affecting my credit score largely and my application to credit cards and banks. Affecting my daily live without a solid case.

_source.complaint_what_happened: **This Complaint is not a Duplicate** Please accept this final written OFFER OF SETTLEMENT BEFORE LITIGATION as my attempt to amicably resolve your continued willful violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act regarding your refusal to delete all of the UNVERIFIED account information from my consumer file. Despite my three written requests and complaints, the unverified items listed below still remain on my credit report in violation of Federal Law. In the results of your re-investigations, you stated to the Creditor Bureaus that you verified that these items are being reported correctly? You still have not identified who in your company verified the accuracy of these accounts or how they verified them? As previously pointed out to you, XXXX Law Dictionary, 6th Edition, 1990, defines Verification as,  Confirmation of correctness, truth or authenticity, by affidavit, oath, or deposition. Affidavit of truth of a matter stated and object of verification is to assure good faith in averments or statements of a party. What this means is that your company must be willing and able to produce a document that proves the account ( s ) in dispute belong to me and the information being reported is accurate and you must be able to do this in a court of law. Someone in your company must authenticate the documents in your files that were used to verify the disputed accounts and to do this they must have 1st hand knowledge of the alleged account ( s ) and all that has ever transpired for the alleged account ( s ), under oath and under the penalty of perjury. Your failure to provide me with verifiable proof required for your company to post the accounts listed below is evidence that it does not exist and therefore is proof that you cant properly Verify the accuracy of any of the disputed accounts. Please be advised that under Section 611 ( 5 ) ( A ) of the FCRA you are required to promptly DELETE all information which can not be verified.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened:
To whom it may concern, ProCollect Incorporated has violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. 

Section 805 ( c ) : states that collection agencies must cease contact upon request, unless further efforts by this company are being terminated. 

Section 806 ( 5 ) : states that a debt collector may not engage in any conduct of which is to harass i.e. causing a telephone to ring continuously. 

Section 807 ( 5 ) : States that a debt collector may not threat to take action that can not legally be taken. 

Section 807 ( 8 ) : States that collection agencies must report that a disputed debt has been disputed. 

Section 809 ( b ) : States that if a consumer notifies the debt collector within the thirty-day period ( a ) that a debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt. 

Be advised that claims made by the creditor have not been validated, and have been disputed twice, while collection efforts continue. Since notifying this company that I was aware of these violations, they have sold the invalid debt to another collection agency. 

ProCollect Incorporated has committed acts of harassment and abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with federal law.
_source.issue: Cont'd attempts collect debt not owed

_source.complaint_what_happened: Hello, I am having issues with the company ProCollect ( XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX ) regarding an alleged debt from an apartment complex I moved out of on XX/XX/XXXX. In XX/XX/XXXX I received a call from ProCollect claiming that I owe {$820.00} stemming from a supposedly outstanding balance from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX. Upon moving out from the aforementioned complex, I confirmed with the Lessor that my balance was paid in full. I was not contacted until almost 6 months later regarding the alleged debt. Since that time, I have submitted written & verbal requests that collection attempts be ceased based on my dispute of the alleged debt 's validity. I was instructed by the company to send proof via email, which I did. However, I received a letter today stating that my credit, ability to obtain employment, purchase a car or home, or qualify for further apartment rental may be " significantly '' affected if I do not remit payment to the collection agency. In my estimation, the continued attempts to collect after verbal & written demands to cease & desist have been made stands in violation of my rights under the FDCPA. This company appears to be incredibly unscrupulous and has continued to harass me via phone calls from various phone numbers with repeated calls, despite my formal request to cease collection attempts.
_source.issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action

When I lived in the apartment complex they indicated that I could use my own refrigerator and they removed the one that actually came with the apartment. When I moved out I did take my refrigerator and they are trying to charge me for my own appliance! They had possession of the one that was initially in the apartment and they agreed to me using my own. There is no money owed to that company. This is unacceptable.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I noticed an account on my credit report from ProCollect in 2015 for an apartment complex that I have never lived in. I have been disputing this with ProCollect and the credit agencies for years with no progress. Not only is the debt not mine, but it is also duplicated on my credit reports. I have submitted documents of proof of residency during this time, but ProCollect still will not have the items removed from my credit report and continue to make attempts to collect the debt. I recently contacted ProCollect, the orginal creditor and the credit bureau to provide me with a validation of the debt in the form of the original lease, cancelled checks for rent and/or money order receipts to show proof that I lived there, which none are able to provide. I don't know if this was identity theft or something that the collection agency just came up with. I have had no other problems with any other companies reporting any type of debt during this time. And since no one can provide me with documents to validate the debt, I have to assume that ProCollect has simply put this on my credit report in error, or deliberately. Although ProCollect has stated over the phone that the accounts appear to be duplicates, they will not even remove one of them, which will at least decrease my debt balance. However, both of these accounts need to be removed! They are not my accounts. ProCollect finally said today that they would possibly remove the duplicate account but I would still be responsible for the other account. They said that I needed to provide them with an identity theft affidavit, in order for them to even consider looking into the other account. However, without them providing me any documentation of the lease or payments to verify that someone else used my information ; I don't feel right swearing to identity theft, when I don't know if that is the case. I do not know how they got my information and I can and have provided proof of my residency elsewhere to the credit bureaus. I do not feel comfortable giving ProCollect any more information than they already have about me, since I don't know how they got my information. The amount that they are showing owing on both accounts is {$6600.00} for a total of {$13000.00}. These accounts need to be removed immediately from all three credit bureaus!
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.complaint_what_happened: Contacted ProCollect Inc based in XXXX, TX on XX/XX/XXXX about a debt that's on my rental history. I never received any letters from them, but when looking at my rental history, there is two separate amounts {$2400.00} and {$500.00} in collections. I contacted them to try make a payment plans, but they do NOT take payments in increments. The representative I spoke to wanted the money upfront aggressively and was extremely confrontational, then she offered me a settlement of nearly 50 % of what was owed on the two accounts. I told her I couldn't make the payments that day, I was just calling to get more information on theses accounts, but could make them in the next two weeks. She declared, " I'll just have to put refusal to pay. '' Confused and at this point, nearly having an anxiety attack, I told her I could make the payments as soon as I could with noting, I needed both account numbers. 3 DAYS later, on XX/XX/XXXX, the same exact representative leaving a voicemail on a Saturday stating I " needed '' to return her call. Confused again, I reached out and told every Procollect representative when speaking to a rep 3 days prior, I thought we had an understanding that I was going to pay in a few weeks. I ended up speaking to the same representative that spoke to XX/XX/XXXX and the conversation didn't go anywhere. When I told her they were breaking the law, she stated, " I'll just put refusal to pay today on your account and now you'll have to owe all of it instead of 50 % '' rudely with hanging up in my face. After the call, I had an anxiety attack, but definitely sought legal advice. We looked into Procollect 's track history of collections with horrible low rating reviews and according to several consumers they do NOT report to the bureaus when people do pay breaking federal laws extremely. Knowing this information, I contacted Procollect XX/XX/XXXX again asking for a different representative, but noticed the pressure to collect and was told I could use XXXX XXXX to send the payments to them. When putting the account number on their website, you don't see what you owe or or ANY statements. We held off on the payments, but contacted the original rental property to validate the debt and property manager told me there was no record of any debt. Procollect Inc should NOT be in business. If there is a debt legitimately, I don't mind paying, but to handle business one must know how and that's for sure. Aggressively harassing consumers and can't validate debt isn't one of them. As far as I know Procollect has put intentionally debt on people 's credit ( including mine ) that isn't validated. The reviews also report the company doesn't even send letters to verify payments. Speaking with my bank personally, they highly advised to never send XXXX XXXX and if I needed to make a payment make sure a receipt is given because with XXXX XXXX, once the money is sent off, it's gone. THAT'S SCARY and not to mention extremely illegal.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
